0.title: Tollywood actor Gopichand suffers injury while shooting in Mysore
0.article_body: Tollywood actor Gopichand suffered an injury while shooting for an action sequence in Mysore. As per reports, the shooting of the yet-untitled film was halted for a while. According to director Sriwass' statement, Gopichand's leg slipped while shooting a scene. "He is doing completely fine. I request fans and friends not to worry about this incident," the statement further read.

1.title: No one can be forced to get COVID vaccine, govt must release adverse effects data: SC
1.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said that no individual can be forced to get a COVID-19 vaccine. The apex court added that the current vaccine policy "can't be said to be unreasonable". The Supreme Court also directed the Indian government to make public the data on adverse effects of COVID-19 vaccination.

2.title: OTT has reintroduced me to the audience: 'Gullak' actress Geetanjali
2.article_body: Actress Geetanjali Kulkarni, who was a part of web shows 'Gullak' and 'Aarya', has said OTT has reintroduced her to the audience. "I did independent films before OTT came but the kind of content OTT showcases is very different and reaches all over the world," she added. Geetanjali further said OTT gives freedom to viewers to choose their content.

3.title: I don't believe in form, I believe in starting from zero in every game: Ruturaj
3.article_body: CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad, who scored his second 50-plus score in the ongoing IPL season on Sunday, has said that he doesn't believe in form and believes in starting from zero in every game. "Irrespective of what you scored in the last game you have to start from zero...[this] is what has helped," he added. Gaikwad scored 99(57) against SRH.

4.title: Anil shares old pic of wife Sunita with Neetu & Krishna Raj Kapoor, fans react
4.article_body: Anil Kapoor on Sunday shared an old picture featuring his wife Sunita Kapoor, actress Neetu Kapoor and the latter's mother-in-law Krishna Raj Kapoor. "Mrs Krishna Raj Kapoor, Mrs Neetu Rishi Kapoor and my wife Sunita #throwbackmemories," he captioned the picture. Reacting to Anil's post, a fan wrote, "Sunita looks like Sonam Kapoor," while another wrote, "Old is gold."

5.title: Will bring back old pension scheme if we win 2023 polls: Kamal Nath
5.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath has said that the old pension scheme will be reintroduced if the party wins the state Assembly polls in 2023. "The old pension scheme for government employees will be implemented like how other states ruled by our party have done," Nath said while speaking at a Madhya Pradesh Shikshak Congress' event.

6.title: Mumbai woman pays for insurance policy from 2015-2020, loses ₹40 lakh
6.article_body: A 61-year-old woman in Mumbai lost ₹40 lakh after a fraudster posing as executive from Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) India, in 2015, told the woman she had earned ₹1.70 lakh on her LIC policy number and that she will get money only after she takes policy worth ₹40 lakh. The woman paid ₹39.66 lakh between May 2015 and July 2020.

7.title: Govt issues health advisory amid intense heatwave, lists dos and don'ts
7.article_body: The government has issued a health advisory amid intense heatwave. Listing dos and don'ts, the government urged citizens to keep themselves hydrated and stay indoors as much as possible. It urged people to wear lightweight cotton clothes and avoid going out. Avoid cooking during peak hours and do not go out barefoot, the government further stated.

8.title: Which batters have been dismissed on 99 in IPL history?
8.article_body: CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad was dismissed for 99(57) against SRH on Sunday. The 25-year-old right-handed batter became the fifth player to be dismissed on 99 in IPL history. RCB's Virat Kohli had become the first batter to get out on 99 in IPL in 2013. Other batters are Prithvi Shaw (2019), Ishan Kishan (2020) and Chris Gayle (2020).

9.title: Gangster's daughter found dead after police raid in UP; locals say she was thrashed
9.article_body: Protests erupted after elder daughter of gangster Kanhaiya Yadav was found dead following a police raid at his house in Chandauli district of Uttar Pradesh. Locals alleged that she was thrashed by a police officer. The younger daughter of the gangster was also allegedly thrashed and has suffered serious injuries, Chandauli District Magistrate Sanjeev Singh said.

10.title: Video from SpiceJet flight caught in severe turbulence surfaces as 14 injured
10.article_body: A video from the Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet flight that encountered severe turbulence during descent has surfaced online. Several cups, bottles, packages can be seen scattered all across the floor of the plane in the video. The SpiceJet Boeing B737 aircraft was landed safely, however, around 14 passengers were injured after cabin luggage fell on them.

11.title: Joint firefighting exercise 'AGNI DAMAN-22' conducted in Pune
11.article_body: A combined firefighting exercise named 'AGNI DAMAN-22' was conducted in Pune on Saturday, in which forces from agencies such as NDRF, SDRF, PMRDA and other fire departments participated. A total of 35 firefighting columns including 12 from civil agencies participated, said a statement. "Drills and procedures, including swift response strategy against all types of fire, were rehearsed," it added.

12.title: Farmer apprehended with suspected narcotics near border in Amritsar
12.article_body: The BSF apprehended a farmer with two packets of suspected narcotics weighing approximately 1.020 kg near the International Border in Amritsar on Sunday. "Alert BSF troops apprehended the farmer while he was trying to conceal suspicious narcotic packets when he had gone ahead of the fence for farming," BSF said in a statement.

13.title: Man given anti-rabies vaccine instead of COVID-19 in UP; probe on
13.article_body: A man was allegedly administered an anti-rabies vaccine by accident instead of the coronavirus vaccine at a health centre in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, officials said on Sunday. Following this, the district's Chief Medical Officer (CMO) ordered an inquiry. The CMO said that there was "no health hazard" and the vaccine would serve as a "precautionary dose against rabies".

14.title: Gangubai took the win: Ira shares note post watching Alia's Gangubai Kathiawadi
14.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter, Ira Khan, took to Instagram to share her thoughts after watching 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Sharing a poster of the film, Ira wrote, "You can develop a fierce will to change the wrong around you because of the trauma you experienced...'Gangubai' took the win. She felt genuine gratitude, pride and joy from what she did manage to achieve."

15.title: Auto driver, friend held for raping two Class 11 Dalit girls in Gujarat
15.article_body: An autorickshaw driver and his friend were arrested for allegedly abducting and raping two Dalit girls in the Keshod town of Gujarat's Junagadh district. The two victims, who are cousins, were on their way to write their Class 11 annual exams when the incident took place, police said. Notably, the two accused were known to the victims.

16.title: Declared ‘persona non grata’, Belgian diplomats leave Russia
16.article_body: Several employees of the Belgian Embassy in Moscow left Russia after being declared 'persona non grata', according to reports. "12 embassy employees against whom this measure was taken have already returned to Belgium," a Belgian government spokesperson said. The diplomats and their families were flown out in Belgian military aircraft due to absence of regular flights between the two countries.

17.title: Free entertainment: Uddhav in apparent reference to Raj's speeches
17.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, in an apparent reference to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's speeches, on Sunday said, "Theatres and cinema halls were shut due to pandemic. So, if one is getting entertained for free, why shouldn't he/she enjoy it?" This comes amid the loudspeaker row in the state. Uddhav also alleged that BJP deceived his father, the late Bal Thackeray.

18.title: BJP creating artificial issues to divide country: Congress' Abhishek Singhvi
18.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said that the BJP is creating "artificial issues" like the hijab and national language issues to divide the country. "BJP is fishing in troubled waters…they want to divide, scare, provoke and antagonise people," Singhvi added. "They draw you into the debate because it suits them...Don't fight on their terms," he stated.

19.title: Need to change mindset of people to check crimes against women: NCW Chairperson
19.article_body: There is a need to bring a change in the mindset of people to put a check on crimes against women, especially incidents of rape and molestation, said NCW Chairperson Rekha Sharma. "It's wrong to blame the dressing of a woman for her rape...There is a need to change the mindset of men," Sharma added.

20.title: Man kills aunt after fight over fencing around papaya sapling in Bihar
20.article_body: A man stabbed his aunt to death following a fight between her and his mother over fencing around a papaya sapling that his aunt had planted in Bihar. The deceased's daughter said that the accused's mother objected to the fencing around the plant, after which, two got into quarrel. The accused then assaulted the victim and stabbed her multiple times.

21.title: Working to prevent a nuclear war: Russia
21.article_body: Amid its conflict with Ukraine, Russia said that it is working to prevent a nuclear war. "The western media misrepresent the Russian threats. Russia has never interrupted efforts to reach agreements that guarantee that a nuclear war never develops," said Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. He added that Russia has built ultrasonic weapons to counter a possible attack from the West.

22.title: Gaikwad becomes joint-fastest Indian to score 1,000 IPL runs, equals Sachin's record
22.article_body: CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad has become the joint-fastest Indian to score 1,000 runs in IPL. The 25-year-old batter took 31 innings to reach the 1,000-run mark, equalling former Mumbai Indians batter Sachin Tendulkar's record. Sachin and Gaikwad are followed by Suresh Raina (34 innings), Rishabh Pant (35 innings) and Devdutt Padikkal (35 innings).

23.title: 1 dead, 18 hospitalised after eating 'rotten' shawarma in Kerala
23.article_body: A schoolgirl died and 18 other students were hospitalised on Sunday after allegedly eating "rotten" shawarma at a food stall in Kerala's Kasargod. The food stall has been sealed and the police have taken the cook into custody. District Medical Officer AV Ramdas said that more cases are expected and doctors and nurses were asked to be present.

24.title: Dhoni never tells beforehand what to do, he does his work on the field: Ojha
24.article_body: After CSK defeated SRH to register their third win from nine games in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha praised MS Dhoni's captaincy, stating, "Dhoni does most of the work on the ground. He does not tell beforehand what to do to the players." Dhoni returned as CSK captain after Ravindra Jadeja stepped down from the position.

25.title: Dearness Allowance of govt employees increased by 5% in Chhattisgarh
25.article_body: Chhattisgarh government has increased the Dearness Allowance of government employees by 5%. This will be applicable from May 1. Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel had taken to Twitter to make the announcement. The dearness allowance of state government employees was 17% and has now reached 22% after the increment.

26.title: India reports 3,157 COVID-19 cases, 2,723 recoveries in last 24 hours
26.article_body: India reported 3,157 COVID-19 cases and 2,723 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,324 COVID-19 cases and 2,876 recoveries. Active cases in India stand at 19,500, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,869.

27.title: Dharmendra shares video after being discharged, says 'I suffered a big muscle pull'
27.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra took to Instagram to share a video after being discharged from the hospital. "Friends, don't overdo things. I did it and I suffered a big muscle pull in the back," he said. "I was in the hospital for two-four days. It was difficult. Anyway, I am back with your good wishes and [god's] blessings," he added.

28.title: Woman offers job to matrimonial match sent by father in B'luru; chat with father viral
28.article_body: A woman has shared screenshot of a chat with her father after she offered a job at her Bengaluru-based start-up to a matrimonial match sent by him. "You cannot hire people from matrimonial sites. What to tell his father now?" her father wrote. "Seven years of fintech experience is great and we are hiring," she replied.

29.title: Gujarat Police to get underwater remote-operated vehicles for rescue ops
29.article_body: In an attempt towards police modernisation, Gujarat Police will acquire underwater remote-operated vehicles (ROV) to carry out rescue operations and other functions. According to the Gujarat Police, the ROV is equipped with a 4k Ultra HD camera and can enter 200 metres into the water. An ROV weighs around 8-10 kilograms and can be operated with a remote, police said.

30.title: BJP fooled innocent Bal Thackeray in guise of Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
30.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said BJP fooled his 'innocent' father, the late Bal Thackeray, in the guise of Hindutva. "I am not going to get fooled because I've seen their tactics," Uddhav added. Speaking about the loudspeaker issue he said, "I don't give importance to this new player of Hindutva. Sometimes he (Raj Thackeray) plays Marathi card and sometimes Hindutva."

31.title: Keep AC on in buses while ferrying students, Gurugram schools told
31.article_body: Amid the prevailing heatwave conditions, the Gurugram administration has directed the schools to ensure that their buses must have air conditioning (AC) on while ferrying students. "We have compiled a list of 500 schools, which are providing transport facilities. We have formed four teams, which will conduct surprise checks to ensure the school buses are following norms," said Deputy Commissioner.

32.title: SRK, Kajol to reunite for a cameo in Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani...': Reports
32.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol Devgan can reportedly reunite for Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' which features Alia Bhatt and Ranveer Singh in lead roles. According to reports, Kajol and Shah Rukh might have a cameo in the film. It's yet to be decided whether the appearance will be for a song or a scene, reports added.

33.title: Bill responds after being accused of inappropriate behaviour on film's set
33.article_body: Veteran Hollywood actor Bill Murray has acknowledged that his behaviour on the set of 'Being Mortal' led to a complaint from a woman and the suspension of filming of his latest movie. "I had a difference of opinion with a woman I'm working with. I did something I thought was funny, and it wasn't taken that way," Bill said.

34.title: Rajasthan's 'Miyan ka Bada' railway station's name changed to 'Mahesh Nagar halt'
34.article_body: Rajasthan's 'Miyan ka Bada' railway station will now officially be known as 'Mahesh Nagar halt'. An official name changing ceremony was held in the Barmer district's Balotra area on Saturday. "It is a long process. Both the Central government and state government give their nod and then the railway station's name changes," Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said.

35.title: Dad messages Aamir Khan, he guided me for projects after 'Taare..' : Darsheel
35.article_body: Actor Darsheel Safary said that his father has been in touch with his 'Taare Zameen Par' co-star Aamir Khan. He also said that Aamir sometimes sends him his blessings and that the actor has guided him on projects after 'Taare Zameen Par'. "He has given me his blessings and his agreements that 'Darsheel, you should do this project'," he added.

36.title: We showed a lot of fight but were unlucky: Williamson on loss vs CSK
36.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said they were "unlucky at times" during their match against CSK, which they lost by 13 runs. "When anyone gets over 200, it'll always be a challenge chasing it down. [But] I thought we responded well to it," he added. Chasing CSK's 202-run total, SRH managed to score 189/6 in 20 overs.

37.title: Pune police dog bows on top of vehicle at parade; video surfaces
37.article_body: Pune City Police on Sunday shared a video of K9 squad dog 'Jack' bowing on the bonnet of a vehicle during the 1st May Parade to mark the formation of Maharashtra. The video shows the dog bowing while the two police personnel salute. "Thank you 'Jack' for joining your human team members for 1st May Parade...Perfect as always!" police said.

38.title: 5 arrested for running over man in Noida road rage; video surfaces
38.article_body: Five persons were arrested for allegedly running over a man in a suspected road rage case near the Mahamaya Flyover on Noida-Greater Noida Expressway on Saturday. The 28-year-old victim is undergoing treatment for brain haemorrhage at Kailash Hospital's ICU. A video of the incident surfaced which showed a man being flung in the air after being hit by a car.

39.title: Prithvi Shaw breaches IPL Code of Conduct, fined 25% of match fee
39.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) opener Prithvi Shaw has been reprimanded and fined 25% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team’s match against Lucknow Super Giants at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Shaw admitted to the Level 1 offence under Article 2.2 of IPL Code of Conduct and accepted the sanction, the IPL said.

40.title: 4-yr-old boy takes mother's car for ride; Dutch police call him 'new Max Verstappen'
40.article_body: A four-year-old boy took mother's car for a drive in the Netherlands and crashed it into two parked cars before leaving the scene bare feet. Bystanders called police after spotting him walking down the street alone in the cold. No one was hurt in the incident, with police saying on Instagram they had discovered a "new Max Verstappen".

41.title: B'luru reports less than 100 new COVID-19 cases after 4 days at 93
41.article_body: The number of coronavirus cases recorded in the past 24 hours in Bengaluru fell below 100 after four consecutive days with 93 cases on Sunday, according to official data. The total number of active cases in the city was 1,701 and the positivity rate was at 2.24%, the data showed. The city also reported 107 recoveries the same day.

42.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Sunday released
42.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 44°C or more as their maximum temperature on Sunday. Rajasthan's Bikaner recorded the highest maximum temperature at 47.1°C, followed by Ganganagar (46.9°C). Barmer recorded maximum temperature of 46.8°C. On Saturday, Maharashtra's Chandrapur had recorded the highest maximum temperature at 46.6°C.

43.title: Hyd Police change car tyres for stranded family at 1 am, share pic
43.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share a picture of police personnel helping a stranded family in the city. “HCP cops Rajesh & Narender spotted a family stranded in a car and helped them,” SHO Bowenpally wrote. The SHO also shared note by man saying the officials checked safety of his family and helped in changing tyres at 1 am.

44.title: In a bid to live with her boyfriend, woman kills husband in Bengaluru
44.article_body: Police have arrested a 27-year-old woman for allegedly killing her husband so that she could live with a man that she was in a relationship with. Police said woman made up a story about robbery attempt to cover up her husband's murder. However, her statements were found to be inconsistent. She confessed the crime when she was confronted with evidence.

45.title: Current WHO funding is not at all serious about pandemics: Bill Gates
45.article_body: Billionaire Bill Gates has called for the establishment of a new global pandemic surveillance unit. In an interview with the Financial Times, he said, "The current WHO funding is not at all serious about pandemics." Gates claimed that the WHO had fewer than "10 full-time people" preparing for future outbreaks and "even those people are distracted with many other activities".

46.title: SpiceJet flight caught in severe turbulence, 12 passengers seriously hurt
46.article_body: Around 12 passengers of a Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet flight suffered serious injuries after the plane encountered severe turbulence while landing, officials said. The plane was landed safely and injured passengers were provided immediate medical assistance, the airline said. As per reports, the injuries occurred after cabin luggage fell on passengers while some hit the food trolley.

47.title: CSK defeat SRH as Dhoni becomes oldest Indian captain to win a T20 match
47.article_body: CSK defeated SRH by 13 runs to register their third victory in IPL 2022. With the win, MS Dhoni became the oldest Indian captain to lead a side to victory in a T20 match at the age of 40 years and 298 days. Opener Ruturaj Gaikwad top-scored for CSK with 99(57) and CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary took four wickets.

48.title: Dharmendra was admitted following back pain, has been discharged now: Hospital
48.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra was hospitalised following back pain during the shoot of a film, Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital said on Sunday. The 86-year-old has now been discharged, it added. The actor was admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the private hospital four days back.

49.title: I was there to bring Babri Masjid down, not Shiv Sena: Fadnavis
49.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said he was in Ayodhya when Babri Masjid was razed and no Shiv Sena leader was present. "I am saying with pride that, yes, I was there to bring the structure down...No Shiv Sena leader was present there," Fadnavis said. He added, "[Shiv Sena] got scared...when they were asked to remove loudspeakers from mosques."

50.title: 1 injured in fire at Russian Defence Ministry site near Ukraine
50.article_body: Russia on Sunday reported that one person was injured in a fire at a Russian Defence Ministry facility in the southern Belgorod region bordering Ukraine. Seven homes had been damaged as a result of the incident, it added. Notably, Russia had last month accused Ukraine of carrying out a helicopter attack on a fuel depot in Belgorod.

51.title: Bored Ape NFT creator's virtual plots sell out for $285 mn of crypto
51.article_body: Bored Ape Yacht Club creator Yuga Labs raised $285 million worth of cryptocurrency by selling 55,000 virtual land plots related to its future metaverse project 'Otherside'. For each plot, it sold an NFT called 'Otherdeed' (worth $7,000), which could only be bought using the project's associated cryptocurrency ApeCoin. In total, the sold-out sale raked in 16,775,000 ApeCoin, as per Reuters.

52.title: World will hear 'Digital India Inside' instead of 'Intel Inside': MoS IT
52.article_body: Minister of State for Communications and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar, during Semicon India Conference 2022's last day, praised Centre's efforts in the semiconductor domain. "In the past, world heard Intel Inside. In the future, the world should hear Digital India Inside," he stated. He added that the government will examine the feedback it received over its Design Linked Incentive (DLI) Scheme.

53.title: He plays express pace like most do against medium: Shastri on Gaikwad's 99
53.article_body: Ravi Shastri praised Ruturaj Gaikwad following his 57-ball 99 against SRH in IPL 2022, saying there's so much to like about the CSK opener. "[He] plays express pace like most do against medium pace. He'll get there in time. No doubts. Classy stuff tonight," he tweeted. "Gaikwad in this form is such a sight to behold," tweeted Irfan Pathan.

54.title: Way above a 5% risk we haven't seen the worst of this COVID-19 pandemic: Gates
54.article_body: Bill Gates, who wrote the book 'How to Prevent the Next Pandemic', told the Financial Times, "We're still at risk of this pandemic generating a variant that would be even more transmissive and even more fatal." He added, "It's not likely...But it's way above a 5% risk that this pandemic, we haven't even seen the worst of it."

55.title: CSK record their highest partnership in IPL history
55.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on Sunday recorded their highest-ever partnership for any wicket in IPL. Ruturaj Gaikwad and Devon Conway shared a 182-run opening stand against SRH to set the record. The previous record was held by Faf du Plessis and Shane Watson, who shared an unbeaten 181-run stand for opening wicket against PBKS on October 4, 2020.

56.title: T Natarajan in contention for India's T20 WC squad: Gavaskar
56.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said SRH pacer T Natarajan is in contention for a place in India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup due to his ability to bowl well in death overs. He added that yorker specialist Natarajan has shown improvement lately as he has been managing to move the ball late, which is deceiving the batters.

57.title: Heavy rain & hailstorm witnessed in Bengaluru amid a heatwave in north India
57.article_body: Amid a heatwave in northern India, many parts of Bengaluru on Sunday witnessed heavy rains and hailstorm. This came just two days after the city recorded a maximum temperature of 36.7 degrees Celsius. Areas like Frazer Town, BTM, Shivajinagar, Vijaynagar and Hosahalli received heavy rains while there were reports of trees getting uprooted.

58.title: NATO conducts military exercises in Europe amid war in Ukraine
58.article_body: Thousands of soldiers from NATO countries on Sunday took part in military exercises in Poland and eight other countries, the Polish military said. In a statement, the Polish military claimed that 18,000 soldiers from over 20 countries were taking part in Defender Europe 2022 and Swift Response 2022. The military exercises are being held amid the war in Ukraine.

59.title: LPG cylinder price hike attack on poor, labour class: Yechury
59.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury criticised the Centre over the hike in petroleum prices and termed it an "attack on the labour class and poor". "Today, when it is Labour Day, there is a new attack on the workers. Not only on the labourers but also on the working people of the entire country," he said.

60.title: Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa calls for 'pro-people' struggle on Labour Day
60.article_body: On lnternational Labour Day, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa urged political parties to set aside differences and appealed to citizens to come together for "pro-people" struggle. "Loss of foreign exchange has created many issues. Managing all these factors is...way to solve [them]," he added. Sri Lanka is in midst of an economic crisis, fuelled by a shortage of essential resources.

61.title: Section 144 in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar from May 1-31 amid COVID-19
61.article_body: In view of a rise in COVID-19 cases and the upcoming festivals, the administration of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar has imposed section 144 of the CrPC from May 1 to 31. Offering Namaz or organising puja in public places will be banned during the period, the Police Commissionerate said. Protests or hunger strikes cannot be held without prior permission.

62.title: Happy that the bowlers pulled it back: Pant after DC's loss
62.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant said he's happy with the team's bowling performance against LSG despite losing the match by six runs at Wankhede Stadium in IPL 2022. "But on these kinds of wickets when...bowlers put up a helping hand, we got to perform as a batting unit as well," he added. Shardul Thakur took all three wickets for DC.

63.title: Punjab bans 3 history books, CM Mann orders action against authors
63.article_body: The Punjab government has banned three history books for allegedly distorting facts related to Sikh history. Education Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer said the book, History of Punjab, had incorrect facts about Sikhs. "Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has ordered action against its writers and publishers besides banning the book," he said.

64.title: BJP asks Punjab CM to step down for 'failing to maintain law & order'
64.article_body: BJP on Sunday asked Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to resign as the Home Minister for failing to maintain "law and order" after the violence in Patiala. BJP general secretary, Subhash Sharma asked why didn't CM Mann take responsibility for the violence despite removing the Inspector General of Police, Senior Superintendent of Police and Superintendent of Police in Patiala.

65.title: Break BJP's arrogance once in Guj & vote for AAP: Delhi CM Kejriwal
65.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls due later this year, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday appealed to voters that they should break BJP's arrogance once and vote for the AAP. "They (BJP) feel that if they give us time till December, Gujarat will turn towards AAP. But I am telling you I am a 'fakkad'," he said.

66.title: CM Yogi launches portal to benefit 11.5 lakh pensioners in UP
66.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday rolled out a new platform, an e-pension portal to ensure transparent and hassle-free disbursement of pensions to retired state government employees. The portal will benefit around 11.5 lakh pensioners in UP. "You will be recognised as pension-yogi, not pension-bhogi, as you are karm-yogi," he said.

67.title: Kangana Ranaut meets UP CM Yogi Adityanath, shares pics from visit
67.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut met with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday. Taking to Instagram, the actress shared pictures of the meeting and wrote, "Today I had the great fortune of meeting Maharaj Yogi Adityanath ji after his tremendous victory in recent elections...I feel humbled, honoured...inspired." Kangana is the brand ambassador of the state's One District One Product scheme.

68.title: TN student dies after clash over wristband with caste identity
68.article_body: A school student in Tamil Nadu died after an alleged clash with fellow students over wearing a wristband with caste identity. The deceased got into a fight with a junior, a Dalit, during physical training hours over the latter wearing a wristband, a police officer said. There was an intense fight before teachers managed to stop them, the officer said.

69.title: Liberal world order is under serious attack: US President Joe Biden
69.article_body: US President Joe Biden while addressing the White House Correspondents Association Dinner on Saturday, spoke about 'threats facing democracy' worldwide. He added, "I'm being deadly earnest. Overseas, the liberal world order that laid the foundation for global peace, stability and prosperity since World War II is genuinely, seriously under assault."

70.title: China reopens makeshift hospital in Beijing to curb COVID outbreak
70.article_body: Authorities in China's Beijing have reopened a makeshift hospital amid a fresh outbreak of COVID-19 in the Chinese capital. Currently, there are 12 COVID-19 patients with mild symptoms in the hospital. Notably, the hospital had been only used during the SARS outbreak in 2003 and a COVID-19 outbreak in 2020, according to state media.

71.title: Will play Hanuman Chalisa twice loudly if loudspeakers not removed: MNS chief
71.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray while addressing a rally in Aurangabad on Sunday said all loudspeakers at mosques in the state must be removed by May 4. He said if it doesn't happen, the Hanuman Chalisa will be played twice loudly. He added that it's a social issue not religious.

72.title: Muslims facing onslaught from BJP, its 'militant' arms: Mufti
72.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said Muslims are facing an "unprecedented onslaught from BJP and its militant political arms". "While the bulldozer became the symbol of state terror against the community, the demons of hate unleashed by the government seem to be on a rampage," Mufti said. She added that her party would continue to fight its democratic and political fight.

73.title: Pacifist approach to war in Ukraine is outdated: German Chancellor
73.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that a pacifist approach to the war in Ukraine is outdated. "I respect all pacifism...but it must seem cynical to a citizen of Ukraine to be told to defend himself against Putin's aggression without weapons," he added. Olaf pledged to continue to support the Ukrainian government with money, aid and weapons.

74.title: Mohsin's wicket of Pant was turning point: Irfan on LSG's win vs DC
74.article_body: Following LSG's six-run win against DC in ongoing IPL, Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "Mohsin Khan's wicket of Rishabh Pant was a turning point of the game. Impressive young bowler." Chasing 196, Pant was dismissed by the LSG pacer at 44 in 13th over. The 23-year-old was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for posting bowling figures of 4-0-16-4.

75.title: You asked me to buy a stock when you were 14, it continued to rise: Musk's mom
75.article_body: Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk tweeted, "Elon, in South Africa, when you were 14, you asked me to buy a stock." She said, "My stockbroker said it's a bad idea...so I only bought...R1000 (similar to $1000 at that time)." Maye added, "The stock quickly rose to R3000...My stockbroker panicked and said I had to sell...and...I sold...That stock continued to rise."

76.title: 2-hour film still best way to tell a story: Sudhir on OTT platforms
76.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra said a two-hour film is still the best way for storytelling than a web series. "OTT is a wonderful place...the economics of...platform do not necessitate that every film be a blockbuster," he stated. "All sorts of films can be made and discovered...That being said, a two-hour film is still...best way to tell a story," he added.

77.title: Becoming a mother made me a better actress: Sophie Turner
77.article_body: Sophie Turner has said that becoming a mother has made her a better actress. "The concept of family has made me an entirely much more emotional person. The empathy is heightened, the feelings about family are just like overflowing," she stated. The actress has a daughter with her husband Joe Jonas and is expecting a second child with the singer.

78.title: UN's 'safe passage operation' for Mariupol civilians underway: Official
78.article_body: UN's ‘safe passage operation' for evacuation of civilians from Ukraine's Mariupol is underway, an official confirmed on Sunday. The operation, which commenced on April 29, is being coordinated with International Committee of the Red Cross, Russia and Ukraine, official added. An estimated 1,00,000 people were believed to be stranded in Mariupol amid ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine.

79.title: 6 Shanghai districts reach 'zero-COVID' status after severe curbs
79.article_body: A local official on Sunday said that six districts in China's Shanghai have attained 'zero-COVID' status, after weeks of severe restrictions on the movement of residents. This status is achieved when a district has three consecutive days with no new daily increases in infections, the official added. A fresh round of COVID-19 testing will be launched in the city today.

80.title: Enjoying batting at no. 3: Hooda on his 52 after LSG's 6-run win
80.article_body: After scoring a half-century in LSG's six-run win against DC in IPL 2022, LSG batter Deepak Hooda said he's enjoying batting at number three position. "I play up the order in domestic cricket too," he added. Hooda hit six fours and one six during his knock of 52(34). Hooda struck a second-wicket 95-run partnership with skipper KL Rahul.

81.title: Actor Dharmendra admitted to hospital in Mumbai: Reports
81.article_body: Veteran Bollywood actor Dharmendra has been admitted to a private hospital in Mumbai, reports said on Sunday. The 86-year-old was reportedly taken to the hospital four days ago and kept in the ICU, but has now been moved out of ICU and is being kept under observation. He will reportedly be discharged in a few days.

82.title: Benedict reacts to 'Doctor Strange 2' being banned in Saudi Arabia
82.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to Saudi Arabia's ban on his film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' over an LGBTQ scene. "It's difficult not to become emotional about it, to be honest. But it is...an expected disappointment," he stated. The film was reportedly banned in the country over a 12-second scene where America Chavez talks about her "two mums".

83.title: Thank god you were born: Virat Kohli to Anushka Sharma on her b'day
83.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli, taking to Instagram, penned a note to wish his wife and actress Anushka Sharma on her 34th birthday. Sharing a picture with Anushka, Virat wrote, "Thank god you were born. I don't know what I would do without you. You're truly beautiful inside out." Reacting to this, Anushka commented, "Stole my words and my heart (CHEEESSSSYYYYY)."

84.title: Suman Bery takes charge as NITI Aayog Vice Chairperson
84.article_body: Economist Dr Suman K Bery on Sunday took charge as the Vice Chairperson of NITI Aayog, according to an official statement. "NITI Aayog's challenge is to...work with India's states, which is where economic development ultimately happens," the statement quoted Bery as saying. Bery has replaced Dr Rajiv Kumar, who had taken over as the Vice Chairperson in 2017.

85.title: Eid-ul-Fitr to be celebrated on May 3 as moon not sighted today
85.article_body: Eid-ul-Fitr will be celebrated on May 3 (Tuesday), the Markaz Chand Committee of Lucknow announced on Sunday. In an official statement, the committee said that the new crescent moon could not be sighted today. Eid-ul-Fitr, which is also known as Meethi Eid, is celebrated on the first day of Shawaal.

86.title: K'taka govt clears 60 projects worth ₹2,466 cr, to create 8,575 jobs
86.article_body: The Karnataka government approved 60 new industrial projects worth ₹2,465.94 crore, which will generate over 8,575 jobs, during the 131st State-level single-window clearance committee (SLSWCC) meeting on Saturday. As per the official statement, 10 large and medium-size projects worth over ₹50 crore each, 49 projects worth ₹15 crore to ₹50 crore each and one ₹5 crore-project were cleared.

87.title: Russian 'smart mines' deployed for the 1st time in Ukraine, can identify tanks
87.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine have started deploying 'smart mines' that have reportedly never been seen on the battlefield before. The PTKM-1R can distinguish between tanks and non-military vehicles and can launch itself up to 100 feet in the air, reports said. The mines can scan the ground and rain explosives at their targets from above.

88.title: SRH's Umran Malik bowls the fastest delivery of IPL 2022
88.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik on Sunday bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022, clocking 154 kmph against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) opener Ruturaj Gaikwad in his second over of the match. Umran overtook Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson, who had clocked 153.9 kmph. Umran has bowled four of the five fastest deliveries in IPL 2022.

89.title: Thousands join anti-govt protests in Sri Lanka amid worsening crisis
89.article_body: Thousands of people in Sri Lanka joined protests against the government on Sunday amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. The protesters were led by the Sri Lankan opposition parties. "So many people are suffering from the cost of fuel and food. There are queues for everything," Sunil Shantha, a 58-year-old university lecturer, said.

90.title: World-beating retail revolution, bravo: Mahindra to Nilekani on e-comm project
90.article_body: Anand Mahindra praised Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani for helping the government in building the open network for digital commerce (ONDC). "We're on the brink of a world-beating retail revolution," tweeted Mahindra. He added, "This will democratise e-commerce, liberating us from the dominance of a few giants & empowering millions of small shop owners...Bravo Nandan Nilekani."

91.title: India to build 1st indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel
91.article_body: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has decided to develop India's first indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel at Cochin Shipyard Ltd (CSL). The Ministry said the vessel will cost  ₹17.50 crore, of which 75% will be funded by the Central government. The hydrogen-based fuel cells are environment-friendly and already being used in bus, truck, and train applications, it added.

92.title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 isn't psychological thriller like part one: Bazmee
92.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' is not a psychological thriller like the Akshay Kumar-starrer and added that the sequel is a horror-comedy. "I was clear I didn't want to make a psychological thriller. If I had made it that way, there would have been direct comparisons," Bazmee stated. The film features Kartik Aaryan.

93.title: Tripathi has serious chance of getting a spot in India's T20I team: Steyn
93.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said middle-order batter Rahul Tripathi, who has scored 228 runs in IPL 2022 so far, has a "serious" chance of getting a place in India's T20I squad. "Given that the position he bats at [number three] is occupied by Virat Kohli in Indian team, it's going to be difficult to get that spot," he stated.

94.title: Russia should seize West's assets over 'theft' of Russian money: Lawmaker
94.article_body: Russia should confiscate property owned by Westerners in country in response to US' suggestion of transferring frozen assets of Russian oligarchs to help Ukraine, senior Russian lawmaker Vyacheslav Volodin said on Sunday. "The proceeds from...sale [of Western assets] should be used for the development of our country," Volodin said, adding that US, Lithuania engaged in "theft" of Russian assets.

95.title: 9 arrested over building collapse in China's Changsha city
95.article_body: The Chinese Police have arrested nine people, including the owner, following the collapse of a building in China's Changsha city, according to state media. These include three people in charge of design and construction and five others who gave a false safety assessment of a guest house in the building. About 20 people remain trapped in the rubble.

96.title: Centre will give additional power supply to UP: CM Adityanath
96.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said the Centre will give additional power supply and the Indian Railways will provide extra rakes to transport coal in the state. "As of now, the power situation is normal in the state," Adityanath said and directed officials to ensure power supply according to the roster. "Don't make unnecessary power cuts," he added.

97.title: Govt issues public health advisory to states amid ongoing heatwave
97.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, the Union Health Ministry has written to all states to disseminate the guideline document 'National Action Plan on Heat-Related Illnesses' to all districts for effective management. The Health Secretary said health facilities need to increase resilience to extreme heat by arranging uninterrupted electricity for constant functioning of cooling appliances.

98.title: LIC getting bids twice the size of its IPO anchor book: Report
98.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO is getting bids twice the size of its anchor book, Bloomberg reported. LIC's anchor book, which contains a list of institutional investors for its IPO, will be announced on Monday. Singapore's GIC Private Limited and Norway's sovereign wealth fund are reportedly among the list of anchor investors for LIC's ₹20,557-crore IPO.

99.title: LSG batting order is fragile without KL Rahul: Jaffer
99.article_body: Wasim Jaffer has said LSG's batting line-up is "fragile" without skipper KL Rahul despite having good finishers in Ayush Badoni, Marcus Stoinis and Jason Holder. "If Rahul scores runs, they reach the score which they want, like 170-180 or more," he added. LSG posted 195/3 in 20 overs, with Rahul top-scoring(77) for the side against DC in IPL on Sunday.

100.title: Due to tukde-tukde gang's actions: Rijiju as UK MP criticises PM Boris for JCB pic
100.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju reacted to UK MP Nadia Whittome's criticism of UK PM Boris Johnson's picture on a JCB machine by saying, "I don't blame [her]." Rijiju said Whittome was "unaware of reality", adding, "It's the result of the negative campaigns launched by the Tukde-Tukde gang whose only aim is to discredit huge achievements of PM Narendra Modi's government."

101.title: There's no 4th wave of COVID-19 in India so far: ICMR
101.article_body: Recent COVID-19 data indicate localised spike in cases in some districts and not the onset of a fourth wave, ICMR's Additional DG Samiran Panda told TOI. "What we're seeing are blips and not the start of a new COVID-19 wave," he said. On the spike in COVID-19 positivity rates in some regions, he said it's mostly due to low testing.

102.title: LSG defeat DC to win 3rd match in a row, move to 2nd on the points table
102.article_body: LSG defeated DC by six runs to register their third victory in a row in IPL 2022. With the win, LSG have moved to the second position on the points table. LSG captain KL Rahul top-scored in the match with 77(51), while LSG pacer Mohsin Khan registered bowling figures of 4-0-16-4.

103.title: Zaheer was one of the most skillful bowlers I've ever faced: Smith
103.article_body: Praising Zaheer Khan, Graeme Smith said the ex-India pacer was one of the most skillful bowlers that he ever faced in his career. "He got the ball to swing away...had a great change of pace. He bowled well with the reverse-swinging ball," he added. Notably, Zaheer dismissed the ex-South Africa skipper on 14 occasions in 27 matches in international cricket.

104.title: Pics show huge traffic in U'khand as tourists rush to Dhanaulti
104.article_body: Amid rising temperatures in parts of the country, huge number of tourists were seen in Uttarakhand's Dhanaulti. Pictures show cars lined up bumper to bumper in the area. The hill states of Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, which are close to Delhi, witness huge number of tourists every year.

105.title: Gupta brothers used ex-Prez Zuma against people of S Africa: Report
105.article_body: Indian-born brothers Atul and Rajesh Gupta had used ex-President Jacob Zuma against the people of South Africa, according to the latest report from Commission of Inquiry into Allegations of State Capture. Zuma had also installed lackeys of the Gupta brothers at key institutions, it said. Zuma "would do anything that the Guptas wanted him to do for them", it added.

106.title: CIA's first-ever CTO Nand Mulchandani studied at a Delhi school
106.article_body: Nand Mulchandani, appointed as the US Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first Chief Technology Officer (CTO), did his schooling at Delhi's Bluebells School International. He has a degree in Computer Science and Math from Cornell and a Master of Science in Management from Stanford Business School. The Indian-American also learned Public Administration at Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

107.title: There's never a shortage of funding for good ideas: Shark Tank's Ghazal
107.article_body: Mamaearth Co-founder and Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh said there's never a shortage of funding for good ideas. Speaking at a TiEcon event in Chandigarh, Alagh added, "I faced a lot of challenges when I first wanted to bring my idea into fruition. It is always better to take risks...than to bear the pain of regret later on."

108.title: Became suicidal in a relationship, tried to cut my hands: Payal
108.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Payal Rohatgi has said that she was suicidal in a relationship in the past and revealed that she tried cutting her hands. "There was this love angle, which was very detrimental in my personal life. Got heavily into drinking...I used to be on prescribed drugs," she stated on the show. The actress is currently dating Sangram Singh.

109.title: BJP MP starts campaign seeking withdrawal of quota for tribal converts
109.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP MP GS Damor said tribals who convert to any other religion mustn't be given reservations mandated for Scheduled Tribes.  "We have been organising delisting rallies in all tribal-dominated districts," Damor said. Reacting to Damor's comments, state Youth Congress chief Vikrant Bhuria said Damor should be "ashamed as he himself is an MP from an ST reserved seat".

110.title: Fighter pilot wrongly identified as 'Ghost of Kyiv'; 'it's a legend', says Ukraine
110.article_body: The 29-year-old Ukrainian fighter pilot Stepan Tarabalka, who was recently killed in battle with Russians, isn't the 'Ghost of Kyiv' and didn't hit 40 planes as has been claimed, Ukraine Air Force Command said. "'Ghost of Kyiv' is a superhero legend whose character was created by Ukrainians!" it added. Tarabalka was killed in an air battle on March 13.

111.title: Greece lifts COVID-19 curbs for travellers ahead of tourism season
111.article_body: Greece on Sunday lifted restrictions for domestic and foreign flights, its civil aviation authority announced. The move, which is set to aid summer tourism in country, will now only require travellers to wear face masks, lifting need for them to produce vaccination certificate or a negative COVID-19 test. "All measures will be reviewed on September 1,” Greek Health Minister said.

112.title: SRH to bowl first against CSK as Dhoni returns as captain, CSK make 2 changes
112.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. The match is MS Dhoni's first as captain in IPL 2022 after Ravindra Jadeja handed back captaincy to him. CSK have made two changes to their team, with Devon Conway and Simarjeet Singh replacing Shivam Dube and Dwayne Bravo.

113.title: Real Madrid's Ancelotti becomes 1st manager to win Europe's top 5 leagues
113.article_body: After Real Madrid won their 35th La Liga title, head coach Carlo Ancelotti has become the first manager to win league titles in all top five leagues of Europe. Ancelotti won the Serie A title with AC Milan. Ancelotti won the Premier League with Chelsea and Ligue 1 title with PSG. He also won the Bundesliga with Bayern Munich.

114.title: Ganguly, Dhoni used to think out-of-the-box, Pant is similar: Latif
114.article_body: Naming his choice for next India captain in limited-overs cricket, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said Rishabh Pant is a good option. "Players like Sourav Ganguly, Mohammad Azharuddin, MS Dhoni were different, they used to think out-of-the-box. Pant is similar in that way, he's unique," he added. Meanwhile, Pant-led DC have four wins from eight matches so far in IPL 2022.

115.title: Murdoch, Shankar's Bodhi Tree to invest $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute
115.article_body: Bodhi Tree, the investment firm backed by James Murdoch and former Disney executive Uday Shankar, is investing $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute. Bodhi Tree said that its investment in the 33-year-old test prep institute is strategic in nature. Founded by Rajesh Maheshwari in 1988, ALLEN operates 138 classroom centres in 46 cities across India and the Middle East.

116.title: BJP's purpose behind UCC is to target minorities: CPI(M) leader
116.article_body: Senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Sunday said that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh and BJP's purpose behind bringing the Uniform Civil Code is to target the minorities of the country. His response came following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's comment stating, "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives. Ask any Muslim woman."

117.title: Why option of merging Pawan Hans with ONGC wasn't explored?: Cong
117.article_body: Congress on Sunday questioned disinvestment of the Centre's 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited (PHL) and asked why the Centre didn't explore merging PHL with Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC). Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said the Centre is "committing a series of blunders" and that the Pawan Hans employee union had also recommended merging PHL with ONGC.

118.title: Vietnam, Japan criticise use of force in Ukraine, call for war to end
118.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and his Vietnamese counterpart Pham Minh Chinh on Sunday criticised the use of force in Ukraine and called for the war to end immediately. Kishida is currently on a visit to Vietnam. Separately, Kishida also criticised China's actions in South China Sea, where the Chinese government has constructed artificial islands and turned them into military outposts.

119.title: Southern Army Commander visits Pune's Armed Forces Medical College
119.article_body: General Officer Commanding-in-Chief Southern Command Lieutenant General JS Nain visited the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC) and Military Intelligence Training School and Depot in Pune. At AFMC, he visited the skill laboratory which has mannequins, state-of-the-art equipment for medical training and simulators. He interacted with the faculty of the college.

120.title: Pics show Angelina posing with kids, visiting railway station in war-hit Ukraine
120.article_body: Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie visited the Ukrainian city of Lviv on Saturday amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The actress visited a Lviv cafe, Lviv's main railway station, and met people displaced by the war with Russia. The 46-year-old actress, a special envoy for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, was heard saying, "I know how trauma affects children."

121.title: May you always shine like this: MI owner Nita Ambani to Kartikeya
121.article_body: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani congratulated debutant Kumar Kartikeya after the team registered its first win in IPL 2022 after beating Rajasthan Royals by five wickets. In a video, Nita congratulated Kartikeya on a call. "You played really well...may you always shine like this," she said. Kartikeya conceded 19 runs in his four-over bowling spell and took Sanju Samson's wicket.

122.title: Need cow shelters at block level to protect them from heat: UP CM to officials
122.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday directed officials to set up shelters that can accommodate 2,000-2,500 cows at block level in bid to protect them from heat amid soaring temperatures. "There should be proper arrangements for green fodder, straw...in...shelters," CM Yogi said. UP government recently announced that it's mulling setting up "cow sanctuaries" for abandoned cattle in 30 districts.

123.title: Some after El Clasico celebrated as if they had won La Liga: Courtois
123.article_body: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, referring to Barcelona's 4-0 El Clasico win, said "some" players celebrated as if they had won La Liga. After Real Madrid won La Liga, Courtois said, "Some celebrated as if they had...won the title, that they had come back [to our level]." Barcelona defender Gerrard Pique had tweeted "We are back" after winning against Madrid.

124.title: Assamese Muslims don’t wish to be mixed with migrant Muslims: Assam CM
124.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that Assam's indigenous Muslim population does not wish to "mix" with migrant Muslims living in the state. "It [state government] will take a decision in the future on who is a Muslim and who is a migrant Muslim. There is no opposition to this in Assam," CM Sarma said.

125.title: Man beaten to death over land dispute with nephew in Rajasthan
125.article_body: A man from Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu was allegedly beaten to death by his nephew and two others on April 28 over a land dispute, police said. The accused attacked the victim, Hem Singh, with rods and sprinkled chilli powder in his eyes. "They hit him on his...chest and head with rods which led to his bones being crushed," the FIR said.

126.title: Ayurveda startup by Gujarat student gets ₹2.5 crore funding at govt summit
126.article_body: Neelkanth Mardia, a final year student of Institute of Teaching and Research in Ayurveda, Gujarat, received ₹2.5 crore in funding from a private company at a summit organised by the Ayush Ministry. Mardia started Ayurveda-based cosmetic company Green Forest Wellness with ₹5 lakh in 2021. However, he wasn't able to expand it due to lack of funds, the Ministry said.

127.title: A confidence-building knock: Gavaskar on Kohli's half-century vs GT
127.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's knock of 53-ball 58 against Gujarat Titans, ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar has said that it was a knock that the former India captain needed. "It's a confidence-building innings. As far as the RCB is concerned, they will be...very happy," he added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Kohli has scored 186 runs in 10 matches so far.

128.title: Won't participate in MNS' Hanuman Chalisa event in Maha: VHP
128.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) National Spokesperson Vinod Bansal on Sunday said VHP and Bajrang Dal activists won't participate in the event being organised by Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques on May 3. "[VHP] doesn't support any political party", Bansal said and added that VHP believes there shouldn't be a ban on recitation of Hanuman Chalisa.

129.title: Mumbai Police received 84 applications for use of loudspeakers
129.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday said that the police received 84 applications for the use of loudspeakers in the city. "Most of the applications are legal and have been approved by the police," he added. Notably, this comes amid the ongoing controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places.

130.title: 'Kashmir Files' depiction of KP exodus is false', says Wiki page; Director reacts
130.article_body: 'Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri shared a screenshot of the film's Wikipedia page which called the movie's 'genocidal' depiction of the Kashmir Pandit (KP) exodus "inaccurate and associated with conspiracy theories". Agnihotri said, "Dear Wikipedia, You forgot to add 'Islamophobia...propaganda...sanghi...bigot...etc'. You are failing your Secular credentials. Hurry, edit more."

131.title: Oh my god, 365 days ago I was in exam hall: US Open champion Raducanu
131.article_body: Reflecting on her past 12 months from being a school student to becoming a Grand Slam champion, world number 11 Emma Raducanu said, "Oh my god, like 365 days ago, I was literally sitting in an exam hall doing paper three." The 19-year-old became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam title at US Open in September last year.

132.title: India's pharma exports hit ₹1.83 lakh crore in FY22: Govt
132.article_body: Pharma exports touched ₹1,83,422 crore in 2021-22 against ₹90,415 crore in 2013-14, a 103% rise in eight years, the Commerce Ministry said. It added that currently, 60% of the world's vaccines and 20% of generic medicines come from India. The pharma exports in FY22 sustained a positive growth despite trade disruptions and drop in demand for coronavirus-related medicines, it stated.

133.title: BJP MLA arrested from official residence for assaulting Odisha officer
133.article_body: Odisha BJP MLA Subash Chandra Panigrahi has been arrested from his official residence in Bhubaneswar for allegedly assaulting a block development officer (BDO) in Deogarh. His two aides have also been arrested. The BDO alleged that the MLA and his associates attacked him when they could not find him at his office as he was busy with some official work.

134.title: Scheme to provide loans to inmates in Maha prisons launched in Pune
134.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil launched a scheme to provide loans to inmates undergoing long-term sentences, at a function held at the Yerawada Central Prison in Pune. The initiative has been launched by Maharashtra State Cooperative Bank for inmates with the aim to provide financial assistance for the livelihood of their families, said a tweet from Patil's Twitter handle.

135.title: Cyberabad Police warn job aspirants against submitting false details
135.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Sunday warned aspirants against submitting fake credentials for job vacancies listed by Telangana State Level Police Recruitment Board. "We'll register cases against those who give any false details. Candidates should take due care in this regard," police tweeted. Vacancies were listed in police, special protection force, fire department, jail department, transport and excise.

136.title: India's current Army, Navy & Air Force chiefs had graduated together from NDA
136.article_body: The three chiefs of India's armed forces- Army, Navy and Air Force- were batchmates of the 61st National Defence Academy (NDA) course. The Indian Army on Sunday shared a picture of the three military chiefs General Manoj Pande (Army), Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari and Admiral R Hari Kumar (Navy) and said, "Tri-services synergy at its best!"

137.title: I avoid things that are evil, stupid & make me look bad; Bitcoin does all 3: Munger
137.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice-Chairman Charlie Munger said, "I avoid things that are stupid, evil, and make me look bad in comparison to someone else." The billionaire added, "Bitcoin does all three." He said Bitcoin is "stupid" because he expects it to go to zero, "evil" because it undermines US financial system's integrity, and makes other countries "look foolish" compared to China.

138.title: Musk takes feedback better than Zuckerberg: Facebook whistleblower
138.article_body: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen said that Elon Musk, who is buying Twitter for $44 billion, is better able to take hard feedback and make meaningful changes than Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. "[Zuckerberg has] surrounded himself with people who tell him what he wants to hear," Haugen stated. She added that she's "cautiously optimistic" about Musk's takeover of Twitter.

139.title: Observe ‘Black May Day’: Sri Lankan leader to people amid economic crisis
139.article_body: In a message issued on International Labour Day, Opposition Sri Lankan leader Sajith Premadasa urged the country's residents to observe a "Black May Day" this year amid its ongoing economic crisis. Premadasa stated that the government's "recklessness" had pushed the country towards the brink of bankruptcy. Sri Lanka is facing an acute shortage of essential supplies, including food and medicines.

140.title: 77-yr-old man robbed, killed inside his house in Delhi's Civil Lines
140.article_body: A 77-year-old man was allegedly robbed and murdered by unidentified men inside his house in North Delhi's Civil Lines, police said. The victim was sleeping alone when the accused broke into his house, robbed cash from the room and attacked him with a weapon, police added. The deceased had four knife injuries, said Sagar Singh Kalsi, DCP (north).

141.title: B'luru's Hoodi Lake restored at ₹2.5 cr, now it's free from sewage
141.article_body: The Hoodi Lake in Mahadevapura zone in Bengaluru has been restored at a cost of ₹2.5 crore. A BBMP official said there were plans to construct a walking path as well but there is a huge shortage of fund. "The lake is now in a good state. It is free from sewage and properly fenced," a lake activist said.

142.title: Was important for me to play till end: MI's Suryakumar after win vs RR
142.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 39-ball 51 against RR in IPL 2022, said it was important for him to play till the end. "But my job at number three was to take the game ahead from where Rohit Sharma left," he added. MI beat RR by five wickets on Saturday.

143.title: Couldn't take picture with Hrithik at 'Koi..' premiere, was heartbroken: Pooja
143.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde said she was heartbroken that she could not take a picture with actor Hrithik Roshan at the premiere of 'Koi...Mil Gaya'. "He came...for 10 minutes, he said hi to everyone...and he left...There is picture of me...all sad next to...his poster of 'Koi...Mil Gaya'...I wanna go back...and be like, 'One day...you'll have...full film with Hrithik Roshan'," she added.

144.title: He added magic in song 'It's magic': Hrithik on 'Koi Mil...' singer Taz's demise
144.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan remembered singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, who passed away on Friday at the age of 54. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Taz added the magic, in 'It's magic' from 'Koi Mil Gaya' with his soulful voice." "Prayers and strength to his family. You will be missed," he added.

145.title: I will definitely take this win: Rohit on MI's 1st win in IPL 2022
145.article_body: After winning their first game of the ongoing IPL 2022, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma has said that he will "definitely take this win". "This is how we play and our real potential came out today (Saturday)," Sharma said after beating Rajasthan Royals by five wickets. "The conditions were different...the ball grips more here (DY Patil Stadium)," he said.

146.title: The rib has been very disabling: Rafael Nadal ahead of Madrid Open
146.article_body: Rafael Nadal, who sustained a rib injury during the BNP Paribas Open, has said that he has trained "very little" for the upcoming Madrid Open. "I arrived very tight...The rib has been very disabling...I haven't been able to do practically anything," he stated. Nadal added he has Roland Garros in mind, and said, "I'm aware...this tournament in Madrid is difficult."

147.title: Allahabad HC issues non-bailable warrant against Mathura DM
147.article_body: For allegedly "disrespecting" the court's order on the payment of pension, the Allahabad High Court has issued a non-bailable warrant against Mathura's District Magistrate Navneet Singh Chahal.  After observing that the April 18 order passed by the DM is nothing but a "gross contemptuous act", Justice Saral Srivastava directed the police to produce DM on the next date of hearing.

148.title: 6-month-old girl & her disabled sister raped in Delhi; 1 arrested
148.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested on Saturday for allegedly raping a six-month-old girl in Delhi's Samaypur Badli area, police said. His friend, who raped the minor's 14-year-old intellectually disabled sister, is absconding, police added. The complainant informed the police that she found the accused allegedly raping her daughters on Friday evening, adding that they escaped after seeing her.

149.title: India has enough edible oil stock: Govt amid Indonesia's export ban
149.article_body: Amid Indonesia's palm oil export ban, the Centre said India has enough stock of edible oil. The present stock of all edible oils is around 21 lakh metric tonne (LMT) and another 12 LMT will arrive in May, the government added. Edible oils' prices are being watched closely so that appropriate measures can be taken to keep prices under control.

150.title: Video shows tornado ripping through Kansas in US; hundreds of buildings destroyed
150.article_body: A video shows a tornado ripping through parts of Kansas in US. The tornado destroyed hundreds of homes and buildings, injured several people and left more than 15,000 people without power, officials said. Moreover, three University of Oklahoma meteorology students traveling back from storm chasing in Kansas were killed in a crash, according to officials.

151.title: It will redefine the action genre for Indian cinema: Kangana on 'Dhaakad'
151.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her upcoming film 'Dhaakad', said it will redefine the action genre for Indian cinema. "It has been...long-standing dream of mine to take up challenging parts and be part of movies that change the norm," she added. Kangana, who plays the lead role in the film, further said she enjoyed playing agent Agni "who stops at nothing".

152.title: 2 govt employees beaten with sticks by villagers in UP
152.article_body: Two employees of the Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited were allegedly beaten with sticks by villagers of Takia village, Budaun on Sunday. The two employees, identified as Fukran Hussain and Nafees Ahmed, had gone to the village to rectify a faulty line, police said. Incidentally, on Friday, an SP MLA allegedly assaulted a UPPCL employee in the district as well.

153.title: KSRTC waives off over 7,000 employee disciplinary cases on Labour Day
153.article_body: As many as 7,200 employee disciplinary cases of Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) were waived off on Sunday on the occasion of International Labour Day, a statement by KSRTC read. "Employees who were absent from duty for less than ten months are exempted from...disciplinary proceedings," it added. Fines ranging between ₹100 and ₹500 have been levied on these employees.

154.title: Mumbai man kills friend for asking to return money, dumps body in water
154.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 22-year-old man for strangulating his 18-year-old friend using a cable wire after she asked him to return the money she had lent to him. The man packed her body in a sack and threw it in the water at Madh beach. He had asked for a friend's scooter to take the body to the beach.

155.title: Pakistan govt channel fails to cover PM's event, 17 of its employees fired
155.article_body: Seventeen employees of Pakistan's state-run PTV channel have been fired for failing to cover PM Shehbaz Sharif's event in Lahore last week. PTV reportedly failed to ensure "proper" coverage due to the non-availability of an advanced laptop for uploading the video footage. The sacked employees reportedly said they were 'scapegoated' by the administration appointed by Pakistan's previous regime.

156.title: Andy Cohen welcomes baby girl via surrogacy, shares pic
156.article_body: American television talk show host Andy Cohen took to his social media handles to announce that he has welcomed a baby girl via surrogacy. Sharing a picture of his daughter, the 53-year-old wrote, "Meet my daughter, Lucy Eve Cohen! Thank you to my rock star surrogate (ALL surrogates are rockstars, by the way) and everyone who helped...make this miracle happen."

157.title: Stuart Broad & I were hoping our careers weren't over: James Anderson
157.article_body: Veteran England pacer James Anderson has opened up about the England cricket board's Managing Director Rob Key's statement that Anderson and Stuart Broad could feature for England this summer. "Stuart and I were hoping our careers weren't over," he stated. "Because of the situation...you're just...unsure of what's going to happen. So now having that clarity is really nice," he added.

158.title: I haven't been home for 9 years: MI debutant Kumar Kartikeya
158.article_body: Spinner Kumar Kartikeya, who made his debut for MI against RR on Saturday, revealed he hasn't been home for nine years. "I'd decided to return home only when I achieve something in life. My mom and dad called me frequently, but I was committed. Now finally I'll return home after...IPL," the 24-year-old, who represents Madhya Pradesh in domestic cricket, said.

159.title: Upto ₹10,000 fine, jail for those plying unfit vehicles in Delhi
159.article_body: Delhi's Transport Department said owners and drivers of vehicles, including those of government departments, found plying without a valid fitness certificate could be fined upto ₹10,000 or be jailed. They could be fined between ₹2,000-5,000 for first offence and ₹5,000-10,000 for subsequent offences. Vehicle owners will also have to pay renewal fee for their vehicle's certificate of registration.

160.title: TN medical college students administered Charak oath; notice issued
160.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Directorate of Medical Education has issued a notice and sought an explanation after first-year students at Madurai Government Medical College were administered the Charak oath instead of the Hippocratic oath on Saturday. An official release said that this was "strongly condemnable". The dean of the state-run college was also relieved of his post and put on a waitlist.

161.title: Multiple Grammy Award winner Naomi Judd dies of mental illness at 76
161.article_body: American singer and actress Naomi Judd, a five-time Grammy award winner, passed away on Saturday at the age of 76. "We lost our beautiful mother to the disease of mental illness. We are shattered," her daughter Ashley Judd said in a statement on Twitter. Mourning her demise, American singer-songwriter Carrie Underwood said, "Country music lost a true legend."

162.title: Carolina Marin wins her 6th European Championships title
162.article_body: Former world number one shuttler Carolina Marin won her sixth European Championships title after beating Kirsty Gilmour of Scotland by 21-10 and 21-12 on Saturday. The 28-year-old shuttler, who made her comeback after a gap of ten months, said, "I feel extremely happy...Being able to come back and play my first tournament of the season is bigger."

163.title: Delhi-NCR 9th most costly office market in Asia-Pacific: Report
163.article_body: Delhi-NCR is the ninth most expensive prime office space market in Asia-Pacific with an occupancy cost of $60 per square feet per year, Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index for Q1 2022 revealed. The region's most expensive office markets are Hong Kong ($186) and Singapore ($105). Mumbai ($50.9) and Bengaluru ($26.7) are at 15th and 21st positions respectively.

164.title: EMIs to rise as HDFC hikes lending rate on housing loans
164.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC has increased its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on housing loans, on which its Adjustable Rate Home Loans (ARHL) are benchmarked, by 5 basis points. The hiked rate, which will increase EMI for existing borrowers, comes into effect from May 1, 2022, HDFC Ltd said. There is no change in the lending for new borrowers.

165.title: My 23rd b'day was very special, I signed my debut film with JP Dutta: Abhishek
165.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan in an interview spoke about his 23rd birthday and said, "[It] was a long time ago! But I...remember it clearly. It was very special." "My birthday falls on February 5, and I...signed my first film, 'Refugee' with Mr JP Dutta on February 1," he added. "I was sure at 23 I wanted to become an actor," said Abhishek.

166.title: I hope it doesn't affect Jadeja: Irfan Pathan on CSK captaincy change
166.article_body: Reacting to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni after six defeats in their eight games in the ongoing IPL season, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "I really feel for Jadeja." Irfan added, "Let's hope it doesn't affect him as a cricketer in a negative way." Jadeja has scored 112 runs in the season so far.

167.title: New Zealand reports first case of Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19
167.article_body: New Zealand reported its first known case of Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 after a person who had travelled from overseas tested positive for it, said the country's Ministry of Health on Sunday. Nearly 12,700 community cases were also detected during the weekend, it added. Two other sub-variants of Omicron were also detected in two overseas returnees.

168.title: Not a bad idea: Musk on using Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter
168.article_body: Elon Musk, who is acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, said it's "not a bad idea" to use Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter. He was responding to billionaire investor Mark Cuban's idea of Twitter users putting up one Dogecoin for unlimited posts. "If anyone contests a post and humans confirm it's spam, they get the spammer's Doge," the investor said.

169.title: Matter of pride for me to lead Indian Army: General Manoj Pande
169.article_body: A day after taking charge, Army Chief General Manoj Pande said it's a matter of pride for him that he has been asked to lead Indian Army. "It has a glorious past that maintained the security and integrity of the nation," he said. The Army chief added, "The geopolitical situation is changing rapidly and we have many challenges before us."

170.title: It was challenging to perform courtroom scene with Big B: Rakul on Runway 34
170.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh spoke about the challenges she faced during the filming of 'Runway 34', where she had to act in front of actor Amitabh Bachchan. She said, "Most challenging part was to perform the courtroom scene with Mr. Bachchan." "I had to show the tension and vulnerability without showing any retaliation or dialogues at the beginning," she added.

171.title: Some residents in Mumbai to be trained in disaster management
171.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that it plans to provide disaster management training to people living in landslide-prone areas. Since many of these landslide-prone locations have access issues and nearby residents are first responders to calamities, training them will help in saving lives, it added. In 2021, over 290 landslide-prone areas were identified in Mumbai by the BMC.

172.title: Won’t allow any loss of territory: New Army chief on standoff with China
172.article_body: Army Chief General Manoj Pande, while talking about the standoff with China along the Line of Actual Control, said Indian troops are holding important physical positions. "We are very clear that we'll not permit any change in the status quo and any loss of territory," he added. He further said, "We have re-aligned our troops after carrying out threat assessments."

173.title: Impressed with planning of 2032 Brisbane Olympics Games: IOC Prez
173.article_body: International Olympic Council (IOC) President Thomas Bach has said that he is "impressed" with the commencement of the planning of the 2032 Olympic Games in Brisbane. "[O]ff to a really wonderful start...We are extremely impressed by the quality of the board of the organising committee, by the diversity," Bach said after IOC's first meeting with Brisbane organisers.

174.title: My favourite designer called me to his hotel room, we had sex: Saisha Shinde
174.article_body: Saisha Shinde revealed on 'Lock Upp' that a designer once invited her to his hotel room. She said, "This is one secret that I never brought out. This Indian designer was my favourite. He called me to his hotel room, I hugged him, and...we had sex." "He had done the same with at least 7 to 8 boys," Saisha added.

175.title: He's bashing the door down as hard as he can: Steyn on Rahul Tripathi
175.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn has praised batter Rahul Tripathi for his performance in the IPL, stating that the 31-year-old is "bashing the [Team India] door down as hard as he can". Steyn added, "The way Tripathi is playing and the way he has played, he has certainly matured." Rahul has scored 228 runs in eight games in IPL 2022.

176.title: 5 Galgotias University students hit by car in Greater Noida, 1 dead
