176.article_body: Out on their evening walk, five students of Galgotias University were hit by a speeding vehicle in Greater Noida on Saturday. According to the police, one of them, identified as Ayush Sharma (23), died during the treatment at the Kailash Hospital while four others are still recovering from their injuries. Notably, the police officials are searching for the unidentified accused.

177.title: US woman gets 2-yr felony probation for casting dead mother’s vote
177.article_body: A 64-year-old woman has been sentenced to two years of felony probation for voting her dead mother's ballot in US' Arizona in the 2020 general election. Her mother had died days before election. She was also fined and asked to perform community service, which was more lenient than what the prosecutor had sought - at least 30 days in jail.

178.title: Pak secures $8 bn financial aid from Saudi amid economic crisis: Reports
178.article_body: Amid an economic crisis in Pakistan, the country has secured financial support worth $8 billion from Saudi Arabia, multiple reports said on Sunday. The deal was secured during Pakistan PM Shahbaz Sharif's visit to Saudi, local media reported. Pakistan has been battling a crisis with high inflation, reduced forex reserves, depreciating currency and a widening current account deficit.

179.title: If a film isn't a hit, people criticise it more than it deserves: Nawazuddin
179.article_body: When asked if there's any insecurity in Bollywood after the domination of films like 'RRR' and 'KGF 2', Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "When a film does well everyone...praises it more than it...deserves. Similarly, if a film isn't a hit, people criticise it more than it deserves." "Now if a Bollywood film becomes a...hit then all these talks will change," he added.

180.title: China's COVID lockdown rules are cruel, we won’t follow them: Taiwan
180.article_body: Taiwan's Premier Su Tseng-chang has termed China's COVID-19 rules as "cruel", adding that country won't follow similar measures. Her comments come as Taiwan's experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases with 17,085 new cases reported on Sunday. Notably, China enforced a stringent lockdown in Shanghai and had adopted measures such as erecting fences outside residential areas to arrest spread of virus.

181.title: Was told to lose weight for auditions, would leave Mumbai scarred: Flora Saini
181.article_body: Actress Flora Saini said that she was asked to lose weight for auditions and that she would leave Mumbai scarred. She also said that she has been rejected so many times and there is a lot of criticism in the industry. "People say, 'you've gained weight, you don't fit into the character'," she added.

182.title: Mumbai likely to receive pre-monsoon rainfall around May 12
182.article_body: Mumbai is likely to record pre-monsoon rainfall around May 12 due to low pressure in the Andaman sea. Heavy rains are likely in Eastern India in second week of May. A low pressure area is likely to form over the same region around May 6 and it is likely to become more marked during subsequent 24 hours.

183.title: My character in Modern Love is something I've attempted for first time: Fatima
183.article_body: Speaking about the response she garnered for the trailer of her upcoming show, 'Modern Love: Mumbai' actress Fatima Shaikh said, "The response that has been coming my way after the trailer release of...'Modern Love'...is sweet and encouraging." "My character in 'Modern Love' is something I've attempted for the...first time and this anthology is very close to my heart," she added.

184.title: ISMC to invest ₹22,900 cr to set up India's 1st chip-making plant in K'taka
184.article_body: International semiconductor consortium ISMC will invest ₹22,900 crore ($3 billion) to set up India's first and largest semiconductor fabrication unit in Karnataka, the state government announced on Sunday. ISMC is a joint venture between Abu Dhabi's Next Orbit Ventures and Israel's Tower Semiconductor. The chip-making plant is expected to generate over 1,500 direct and 10,000 indirect jobs.

185.title: World may face a recession within the next two years, warns Singapore PM
185.article_body: Singapore PM Lee Hsien Loong has warned that the world may face a recession within the next two years. Loong said that the Russia-Ukraine war has clouded Singapore's post-COVID-19 recovery outlook, adding that Singaporeans are already feeling the impact of the war on the cost of living. Singapore is facing an S$8 billion hit a year from higher energy prices.

186.title: Man dressed as sadhu sexually assaults 12-yr-old girl in Jharkhand
186.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted in Jharkhand's Khunti district by a man, who visited her house in the guise of a sadhu to seek offerings, police said on Sunday. Three men dressed as sadhus visited the girl's house and the main accused went inside to drink water when the girl ran out of the house screaming, police said.

187.title: Indian-American Nand Mulchandani to be CIA's first-ever CTO
187.article_body: Indian-American entrepreneur Nand Mulchandani has been named the US government's Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first-ever Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Mulchandani is a serial entrepreneur who has co-founded and been CEO of startups namely Oblix, Determina, OpenDNS and ScaleXtreme. He has studied at Cornell University, Stanford Business School and Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

188.title: Was very nervous, he made me comfortable: Sethupathi on working with Shahid
188.article_body: Vijay Sethupathi, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Shahid Kapoor in the show 'Farzi', spoke about working with Shahid and said, "I was very nervous since I had to shoot with Shahid...on the...first day." "But he made me...comfortable, especially since he'd already shot for 'Farzi' for 40 days," Vijay added. The show is being directed by Raj & DK.

189.title: Masks will be compulsory in Maha again if COVID-19 cases rise: Tope
189.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Sunday that the state will bring back its compulsory mask mandate if COVID-19 cases continue to rise. His comments come after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray appealed to people to wear masks outdoors to restrict a possible "fourth wave" of COVID-19 infections. Maharashtra government made wearing masks optional for residents last month.

190.title: Don't believe permanent ban is right: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey
190.article_body: Ex-Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, in an apparent hint to the permanent suspension of Donald Trump's Twitter account in 2021, said he doesn't believe that any permanent ban, with the exception of illegal activity, is right. A "transparent system", both in policy and operations, is more important than whether Twitter is run by a company or an open protocol, Dorsey added.

191.title: LIC to retain some stake in IDBI Bank for bancassurance gains: Chairman
191.article_body: LIC will retain a part of its stake in IDBI Bank to reap the benefits of the bancassurance channel, Chairman MR Kumar said. He added that LIC doesn't want to "hold a big stake" but some holding as it has been a win-win for both entities. LIC had bought a 51% stake in IDBI Bank in 2019 for ₹21,624 crore.

192.title: Man wearing Zomato t-shirt, 2 teenagers killed in car-bike crash in Delhi
192.article_body: Three people, including a motorcycle rider wearing a Zomato t-shirt, died in an accident involving a car and a motorcycle in Delhi. Other two deceased have been identified as 17-year-old Jyoti and her 19-year-old sister Bharti. Police said the motorcycle was in front of the car but the sequence of events leading to the accident is yet to be established.

193.title: It's going to take some time: Producer Barbara on casting next James Bond
193.article_body: James Bond producer Barbara Broccoli said in an interview that "it's going to take some time" before Daniel Craig's replacement is named. "It's a big decision. It's not just casting a role. It's about a whole rethink about where we're going," Barbara said. 'No Time To Die', which was released in 2021, marked Daniel's final outing as the 007 agent.

194.title: Mumbai Police capable of maintaining peace in city: Commissioner
194.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday said that the city's police force is capable enough to deal with people who try to disturb the peace. He also sought the cooperation of residents in maintaining the law and order. Notably, Pandey's comments come after MNS chief Raj Thackeray's ultimatum to remove loudspeakers in mosques by May 3.

195.title: CCTV footage of Noida mall fight that led to 30-year-old man's death released
195.article_body: CCTV footage of the Gardens Galleria fight that led to the death of a 30-year-old man has surfaced. In the video, staff and bouncers of the Lost Lemons resto-bar in Noida outside which the fight took place, are seen beating one person. The fight allegedly broke out on April 25 over the bill and resulted in Brijesh Rai's death.

196.title: Me, Suryakumar wanted to take chase vs RR as deep as possible: Tilak
196.article_body: After MI's five-wicket win against RR in IPL 2022, MI batter Tilak Varma said that he and teammate Suryakumar Yadav wanted to take the 159-run chase as deep as possible. Tilak (35) and Suryakumar (51) posted an 81-run third-wicket stand and helped MI register their first win this season following eight consecutive losses. MI scored 161/5 in 19.2 overs.

197.title: PV Sindhu argues with chair umpire and chief referee over point penalty, video goes viral
197.article_body: A video went viral showing Indian shuttler PV Sindhu arguing with the chair umpire and chief referee after being given one point penalty for taking time to serve in her Badminton Asia Championships semi-final against Japan's Akane Yamaguchi. Sindhu argued that Yamaguchi "wasn't ready" but officials stayed with their decision. Sindhu, who was leading at the time, lost the match.

198.title: Kuldeep is thriving in DC's positive environment: Ponting
198.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said the positive environment provided by the franchise is helping spinner Kuldeep Yadav to thrive in the ongoing season. Ponting added, "We're really pleased for him...and [making] sure we keep things in line with him and not let him get too far ahead of himself." Currently, Kuldeep is the second-highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022.

199.title: DMK stands for upliftment of workforce: TN CM Stalin on Labour Day
199.article_body: Speaking at an event on International Labour Day in Chennai, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Sunday that the DMK government stands for the upliftment of the workforce. "It is...DMK...that brought the use of bicycle rickshaws instead of hand-pulled rickshaws...For the first time in India, the DMK government provided free electricity to farmers in [Tamil Nadu]," he added.

200.title: Russian chiefs don't tell soldiers about expected losses: Zelenskyy
200.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday claimed that Russian commanders are lying to their soldiers and don't tell them about new losses expected. He alleged that they're not told that Russian army is preparing additional refrigerator trucks for "storing the bodies". "It's better for you to survive in Russia than to perish on our land," he said to Russian soldiers.

201.title: LSG to bat first against DC, Krishnappa Gowtham replaces Avesh Khan
201.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first against DC in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. DC are fielding an unchanged playing XI. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Avesh Khan. LSG are currently third on the points table, while DC are placed sixth.

202.title: Pune student beaten up with sticks at college event; 4 arrested
202.article_body: A student of the Sinhgad College of Arts, Science and Commerce in Pune was allegedly beaten up by a history-sheeter and his associates during an event at the college. Four people have been arrested in connection with the incident so far. They allegedly forced the student to sit on a two-wheeler and took him to a lane outside the college.

203.title: Bulldozers, aircraft deployed to fight massive wildfire in US
203.article_body: Over a thousand firefighters supported by bulldozers and aircraft were deployed to fight a massive wildfire in the United States. The fire reached closer to a city in northern New Mexico on Saturday. According to officials, the fire has grown in size from 266 sq-km to 393 sq-km and has destroyed at least 166 homes.

204.title: Jet fuel price up 3.22%, reaches record high after 2022's 9th hike
204.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 3.22% on Sunday to an all-time high, reflecting a surge in global energy prices. ATF now costs ₹1,16,851.46/kl in Delhi, ₹1,15,617.24/kl in Mumbai, ₹1,21,430.48/kl in Kolkata and ₹1,20,728.03/kl in Chennai. ATF prices have increased by ₹42,829.55/kl, or over 50%, in nine consecutive hikes since January 1.

205.title: Each and every EV fire incident will be probed: Transport Secretary
205.article_body: Each and every incident of electric vehicles (EVs) catching fire will be investigated, Road Transport and Highways Secretary Giridhar Aramane told PTI. There have been multiple incidents of EVs catching fire recently, resulting in deaths and severe injuries to people. Aramane said an expert panel has been formed to enquire into the matter and it hasn't submitted its report yet.

206.title: SRK is one of my favourite action heroes; he uses his body so well: Tiger
206.article_body: When asked about his all-time favourite action hero in Bollywood, actor Tiger Shroff named actors Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar and Shah Rukh Khan. Speaking about Shah Rukh, Tiger said, "If you have seen his films, whether it's 'Darr' or 'Baazigar', when he gets hit he really reacts...He's an actor who uses his whole body so well. It's phenomenal."

207.title: Nobody ever told me to freeze my eggs: Payal on not being able to get pregnant
207.article_body: In an episode of 'Lock Upp', contestant Payal Rohatgi shared she cannot conceive. Speaking about it, she said, "I came from Ahmedabad to do something in life. I've been earning for my family since very young." "Nobody ever told me to freeze my eggs. While chasing, I didn't realise...I'll be so late that I can't become a mother," she added.

208.title: My visit to Europe comes at a time when it's facing many challenges: PM Modi
208.article_body: Ahead of his three-day trip to Denmark, Germany and France, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said he is travelling to Europe at a time when the region faces many challenges and choices. "Through my engagements, I intend to strengthen the spirit of cooperation with our European partners, who are important companions in India's quest for peace and prosperity," he said.

209.title: Team officials didn't have a say in this: CSK CEO on Jadeja handing back captaincy to MSD
209.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan said, "This is a decision taken by the team management and Jadeja." He added, "Team officials didn't have a say in this." He further said that Dhoni is taking up the responsibility in the larger interest of the franchise.

210.title: Man shoots alleged lover's brother dead in UP, then kills self
210.article_body: A 19-year-old man allegedly killed himself after he attacked a woman and her mother and shot dead her brother in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit on Saturday, police said. The man was reportedly in a relationship with the woman but her marriage was fixed to another person. The man shot the brother after the latter intervened when he attacked the two women.

211.title: IMD lists states where heatwave will continue in May
211.article_body: Northwest and central India will not get respite from the prevailing heatwave in May, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said. Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat are "expected to experience above-normal temperatures in May", IMD DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said. Western Rajasthan may report temperatures of over 50 degrees Celsius, he added.

212.title: BBMP extends deadline for 5% rebate on full property tax payment to May 31
212.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the rebate period on full payment of property tax till May 31. Earlier, the civic body had announced that people can get a 5% rebate if they pay their property tax for the 2022-23 financial year before April 30. The amount can be paid using BBMP's website.

213.title: Ahead of Eid, Hyd haleem store provides employment to over 1,000 youths
213.article_body: Amid the ongoing holy month of Ramadan, a haleem store in Hyderabad has provided employment opportunities to over 1,000 youths on a part-time basis. The store, Pista House, has reportedly employed several college students as cashiers and supervisors across its several outlets in the state. Over 400 persons have also been employed to prepare the dish (haleem), store's owner said.

214.title: World's richest man Elon Musk shares investment advice for 'long-term'
214.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk shared investment advice after tweeting he's been "asked a lot" about it. "Buy stock in several companies that make products & services that *you* believe in...Only sell if you think their products & services are trending worse," Musk tweeted. He added, "Don't panic when the market does...This will serve you well in the long-term."

215.title: Pelosi highest-ranking US official to visit Ukraine after war, Zelenskyy shares video
215.article_body: US Speaker of the House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi has become the highest-ranking US official to visit Ukraine since the war with Russia began. Pelosi met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. Sharing a video of Pelosi's visit on Twitter, Zelenskyy wrote, "The United States is a leader in Ukraine's strong support in the fight against Russian aggression."

216.title: 32-year-old man arrested for harassing woman in Mumbai
216.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a man (32) for allegedly harassing and passing lewd comments at a woman (28) in the city's Andheri (West) area. The accused, identified as Govind Chavan, whistled at the complainant and later, commented on the complainant's dress when he was confronted by her, she alleged. Notably, Chavan's lawyer has claimed that the accused has been "falsely implicated".

217.title: 1 killed, several injured in shooting at US’ Mississippi festival
217.article_body: One person was reportedly killed and several others were injured in a shooting incident that took place at the Mississippi Mudbug Festival in the US. According to Hinds County Sheriff Tyree Jones, several people with unknown injuries were taken to hospitals. The event, being hosted at the Mississippi State Fairgrounds, includes live entertainment, cooking contests and amusement park rides.

218.title: If you offered me all the Bitcoin in the world for $25, I wouldn't take it: Buffett
218.article_body: Warren Buffett, the world's sixth richest person and Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, said if someone offered him all of the Bitcoin in the world for $25, he wouldn't take it. "What would I do with it? I'd have to sell it back to you one way or another," the 91-year-old added. Buffett also said that Bitcoin doesn't produce anything tangible.

219.title: Blake Lively to make film directorial debut with adaptation of 'Seconds'
219.article_body: American actress Blake Lively is all set to make her feature film directorial debut with an adaptation of the graphic novel 'Seconds', by Scott Pilgrim creator Bryan Lee O'Malley. Last year, Blake helmed the music video for Taylor Swift's 'I Bet You Think About Me', which received an Academy of Country Music Award nomination for Video of the Year.

220.title: I might be GT captain, but there's no hierarchy in team: Hardik Pandya
220.article_body: After registering their eighth win from nine games in IPL 2022, GT captain Hardik Pandya said he couldn't have asked for a better debut season for the franchise. "I don't like to grow as an individual. I like to grow with my teammates...That's the reason [for] our success as well...I might be the captain, but there's no hierarchy," he added.

221.title: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases, 3 containment zones emerge in Bengaluru
221.article_body: Three containment zones have been reported in Bengaluru. Two containment zones have been reported in Mahadevapura and one in Bengaluru South. Reports said that the city had over 100 containment zones during the third COVID-19 wave. The Karnataka government has also instructed officials to start surveillance measures for those arriving from Japan and Thailand.

222.title: GST collection hits all time high of ₹1.68 lakh crore in April 2022
222.article_body: The GST revenue collection for April 2022 was at its highest ever at ₹1.68 lakh crore, Finance Ministry said. It's ₹25,000 crore more than the next highest collection of ₹1,42,095 crore in March 2022. Of the ₹1.68 lakh crore collected in April 2022, CGST is ₹33,159 crore, SGST is ₹41,793 crore, IGST is ₹81,939 crore and cess is ₹10,649 crore.

223.title: KGF: Chapter 2's Hindi version crosses ₹350-crore mark
223.article_body: The Hindi version of Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has crossed the ₹350-crore mark at the box office. It is the tenth film in Hindi to cross the ₹300-crore mark, and the first to do so after the COVID-19 pandemic began. The film also stars Sanjay Dutt, Srinidhi Shetty, Raveena Tandon and Prakash Raj.

224.title: Ant-Man 3 to release on Feb 17, The Marvels to hit theatres on July 28
224.article_body: The release dates of Marvel Studios' 'The Marvels' and 'Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania' were swapped by Disney on Friday. 'Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania', previously scheduled to release on July 28, 2023, will now release on February 17. The release date of 'The Marvels', the sequel to 'Captain Marvel', has been moved to July 28, 2023 from February 17.

225.title: 5 people attacked me, beat me up with sticks and clubs: Influencer Kili Paul
225.article_body: Tanzanian influencer Kili Paul, who is known for lip-syncing to Indian film songs, took to Instagram Stories and revealed that he was attacked by five people. He added that he suffered an injury on his right thumb after a knife attack. "I got 5 stitches and I was beaten by sticks and clubs," he wrote.

226.title: Man flashes private parts at women, tries to hold their hands at Mangaluru mosque
226.article_body: A 26-year-old man in Karnataka's Mangaluru has been arrested for allegedly flashing his private parts at women inside a mosque. The accused has been identified as Sujith Shetty. Shetty entered the mosque and tried to hold the hands of several women and misbehaved with them and even flashed his private parts at them and disrupted the programme, said police officers.

227.title: SP MLA assaults power station worker over outage in UP; booked
227.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Ashutosh Maurya and his supporters have been booked for allegedly assaulting a power sub-station operator in UP's Budaun. Maurya reportedly claimed that he visited the station after receiving complaints about power outage from local residents. A video that surfaced on social media showed the MLA misbehaving with the operator, said police.

228.title: Suryakumar hugs angry Chahal to console him over DRS call, video goes viral
228.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav hugged RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal to console him after Umpire's Call in the DRS denied him Suryakumar's wicket in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. In a video that went viral, Chahal seemed angry after the review. "I didn’t tell him anything and it was just a sweet banter between him and me," Suryakumar later said.

229.title: 53,942 loudspeakers removed, sound level of 60,295 reduced: UP Police
229.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police said that they have removed 53,942 loudspeakers from various religious places till 7:00 am on Sunday. "The sound level of 60,295 loudspeakers was reduced and brought down to the level of standard parameters," Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) in Uttar Pradesh, Prashant Kumar said. Districts had earlier been asked to submit a compliance report.

230.title: Hardik has been better than many great batters at the moment: Harbhajan
230.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said Hardik Pandya can bat at number three or four for Team India and there's no need for him to be sent down the order. "Hardik has been better than many other great batters at the moment...You can have someone else as a finisher," stated Harbhajan. Currently, Hardik is the third-highest scorer in IPL 2022.

231.title: I'm in a happy space with Shivashish; don't want to jump into marriage: Zareen
231.article_body: When asked about her wedding plans with her boyfriend, former Bigg Boss contestant Shivashish Mishra, actress Zareen Khan said no marriage is on the cards. "I've realised that Shiv is very similar to me, the kind of person I am," she added. "I'm in a very happy space with Shivashish right now; I don’t want to jump...into marriage," Zareen said.

232.title: Bombay HC upholds life-term of Pune man who stabbed aunt 54 times
232.article_body: Bombay High Court has upheld a session court's order sentencing a 33-year-old man from Pune to life imprisonment on charges of murdering his maternal aunt by stabbing her 54 times. The accused had claimed that no motive had been attributed to him for committing the crime. The accused was 21 years old at the time of the murder.

233.title: Want to do films that justify the time I'll spend away from my child: Anushka
233.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma said that she has always been a "seeker of balance" in her work and personal life. She added, "I will always want to be a part of the best scripts that come my way." Anushka said she's focusing on the scripts that will make it worth her time to stay away from her daughter Vamika.

234.title: Bengaluru police help take man who fell unconscious to hospital
234.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Namma 112 on Saturday tweeted that police officers have helped deliver an unidentified man, who is in his 30s, to a hospital after they found that he had fallen unconscious. The officers had arrived at the spot after receiving information that a man was seen lying on the road. The officers had immediately called an ambulance.

235.title: Most undertrials are poor, should get bail wherever possible: PM
235.article_body: PM Narendra Modi appealed to the Chief Ministers of states and the Chief Justices of High Courts to prioritise cases of undertrials. "There are over 3.5 lakh prisoners in jails who are undertrials. A majority of these are poor or from ordinary families," said PM Modi. Bail must be granted to them wherever possible, he added.

236.title: 'Pan-India' is a disrespectful word for movies, it should be removed: Actor Siddharth
236.article_body: Talking about several regional films being referred to as 'pan-India films', actor Siddharth said, "Pan-India is a very disrespectful word." He added, "The term is being used to describe that a regional film means there is something called an Indian film, which comes from Bollywood." "The term pan-India should be removed...it should just be called an Indian film," Siddharth stated.

237.title: Andrew Garfield confesses he was texting friends after Will slapped Chris at Oscars
237.article_body: Andrew Garfield has admitted he was texting friends after Will Smith slapped presenter Chris Rock during the 2022 Academy Awards.  He said, "Everyone's texting me, asking me, like, what the vibe in the room is. At that moment, my friends took priority over Kevin." Notably, Kevin Costner was introducing the director nominees when Garfield was pictured texting on his phone.

238.title: Some people giving communal colour: Tejashwi on loudspeaker row
238.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around the use of loudspeakers in religious places, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that some people are giving a "communal colour to unnecessary issues". "I want to ask a question...They (loudspeakers) were invented in 1925 and have been used in temples and mosques...since the 1970s. Didn't God exist when loudspeakers were not there?" Yadav tweeted.

239.title: Patiala clash 'mastermind' Barjinder Singh Parwana arrested from Mohali
239.article_body: Barjinder Singh Parwana, the alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Patiala, has been arrested. Range Inspector General MS Chhina said that Parwana was arrested from Mohali. A clash had broken out between members of Shiv Sena, who had called for an 'anti-Khalistan' march, and Sikh activists and Nihangs outside the Kali Mata temple.

240.title: Win means a lot, it hasn't been easy for us, we need to stick together: Ishan
240.article_body: MI opener Ishan Kishan has said their win against RR "means a lot" as it hasn't been easy for them in the ongoing IPL season. "We need to stick together...Hopefully, we win a few more matches," he added. On his 26-run innings, Ishan said, "Intent was to get boundaries in the powerplay to make it easier for the other batters."

241.title: 26-yr-old man steals 4 litres of milk from shop in Delhi, arrested
241.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing four litres of milk from a shop in Delhi's Kalkaji area on Saturday. Police said that the shopkeeper saw the man stealing four packets of milk and caught him red-handed. The shopkeeper then called the police, handed the man over and gave a written complaint.

242.title: Angelina Jolie rushes to bomb shelter in Ukraine amid air raid warning, video surfaces
242.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actress Angelina Jolie running towards a bomb shelter after an air raid siren went off in Ukraine's Lviv amid war with Russia. In the video, Jolie can be seen rushing out of a building with a group and saying, "I'm okay" to the camera. Earlier, she was filmed at a cafe, meeting some locals.

243.title: I was blown away by Sonali's bald look, asked Ayushmann 'Can I shave': Tahira
243.article_body: When asked what was the inspiration behind her bald look after her cancer treatment, Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap said she was blown away by Sonali Bendre's bald look after the latter's chemotherapy. "I was...34 when I saw that and I thought, 'What a woman'," she added. "So, when this was happening...I asked Ayushmann if I should shave," Tahira added.

244.title: 'What's the obsession with lip-syncing?' Twitter user asks Diljit, he responds
244.article_body: Singer Diljit Dosanjh responded to a Twitter user who accused him of lip-syncing during one of his performances at a concert. "What's the obsession with lip-syncing?" the user wrote while reacting to a video of Diljit performing at the Born To Shine World Tour in Jalandhar. "Lip Syncing...WTH? It's live, man. Don't disrespect the musicians," Diljit responded.

245.title: 21-yr-old rape accused jumps off Faridabad court building, dies
245.article_body: A 21-year-old man, accused of rape, jumped from the sixth floor of a court building and died in Faridabad after his bail plea hearing on Saturday. The deceased was arrested last year for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor. He had secured an interim bail later. His father claimed that the girl's parents were demanding money from him.

246.title: Karnataka man makes wife burn camphor on hand in 'fidelity test'
246.article_body: The police have launched a search for a man who allegedly forced his wife to burn camphor on her hand in a "fidelity test" in Veerenahalli village in Karnataka's Kolar. The police were informed about the matter after the head of an NGO got involved. The wife reportedly had not complained due to fear of retribution from her husband.

247.title: 18-year-old nurse found hanging from hospital wall in UP's Unnao, family allege rape
247.article_body: The body of an 18-year-old nurse was found hanging by a rope from the outer wall of a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao district on Saturday. The woman's family alleged that she was gangraped and murdered and lodged an FIR naming four people including the owner of hospital, police said. Notably, the deceased had joined the hospital a day before.

248.title: Odisha announces 6-9 am teaching timings in schools amid record heat
248.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave, Odisha has rescheduled the timings of teaching hours in schools. "Government after careful consideration, has been pleased to reschedule the timing of teaching hours in all schools from 6.00 am to 9.00 am wef 2nd May, 2022. However, the examination already scheduled by different Boards/Councils will continue as usual," the government notification read.

249.title: People asked us to do a lip filler, get a nose job: Singers Prakriti & Sukriti
249.article_body: Twin singers Prakriti and Sukriti Kakar said people asked them to do a lip filler and get a nose job done. "We both have typical Punjabi noses, so a lot of people used to be like maybe you should try it," the twins said. "For me, body positivity...means feeling good in your skin no matter...what shape you're in," Prakriti added.

250.title: He always carried cash in Gucci bag for no particular reason: Deb remembers Taz
250.article_body: Singer-songwriter Deb remembered singer Tarsame Singh Saini, popularly known as Taz from Stereo Nation, who passed away on Saturday at the age of 54. "He was always carrying loads of cash in his Gucci sling bag for no particular reason. 'You never know; I might need it!'," Deb said, adding, "He was fighting his own battles."

251.title: It was wet all over the place, so I felt we were 10-15 runs short: Ashwin
251.article_body: After their five-wicket defeat against MI, RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said their 158-run total was 10-15 runs short as there was "heavy dew" during the second innings. "It was wet all over the place...and it makes a massive difference, good deliveries tend to get over-pitched," he added. Ashwin picked one wicket, conceding 21 runs in his four overs.

252.title: 4.5kg of Ephedrine drug worth ₹90 lakh seized at Bengaluru airport
252.article_body: A consignment of the Ephedrine drug, weighing over 4.49kg, was seized from the International Courier Terminal at the Bengaluru airport by various agencies. The drug consignment, which amounted to over ₹89.92 lakh, was hidden inside a parcel along with readymade garments and was ready to get despatched to Australia, a Customs official said. Notably, the exporter is a Vijayawada resident.

253.title: Made an original song, just used an old line: Kanika on being accused of stealing Pak song
253.article_body: After Pakistani singer Hadiqa Kiani accused Kanika Kapoor of copying her song 'Boohey Barian', Kanika said, "We made an original song." She added, "It's not a cover version, it's a new song completely." Kanika further said they just used a "hook line" from an old Punjabi folk song. She stated that they had no intention of stealing anybody's work.

254.title: Jos Buttler records most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player
254.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler has recorded the most runs ever in an IPL season by an RR player. With his 52-ball 67-run knock against MI, Buttler took his tally of runs in IPL 2022 to 566 in just nine matches. Buttler overtook Ajinkya Rahane, who had held the previous record with 560 runs for RR in IPL 2012.

255.title: 32-yr-old man dies as Haryana Roadways bus hits bike in Gurugram
255.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Tekchand, was killed and his colleague, Lal Mohan, was injured after a Haryana Roadways bus allegedly hit the motorcycle they were travelling on. Police said that the victims were rushed to the hospital where Tekchand was declared dead on arrival. Police said that FIR has been registered in the case.

256.title: Germany moves ICJ to deny Italy reparations for Nazi atrocities
256.article_body: Germany has registered a case in the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to stop Italy from claiming reparations over Nazi atrocities during World War II. This comes ahead of an Italian court ruling on whether to auction German-owned buildings. On several occasions in the past, Italian courts have directed Germany to pay for damages due to the Nazi atrocities.

257.title: 2nd bombing in 2 days in Afghanistan's Kabul ahead of Eid; 1 dead
257.article_body: One woman was killed and three others were injured after a bomb blast in a passenger van in Afghanistan's Kabul on Saturday, in the second incident in two days ahead of Eid al-Fitr, an official told Reuters. Earlier, over 50 worshippers were killed in a bomb blast at a mosque there. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, Reuters reported.

258.title: Viral pic of crying young woman is fake, Zelenskyy's daughter didn't escape to Poland
258.article_body: A viral photo claiming to show the 17-year-old daughter of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has "fled to Poland" is false, reported Deutsche Welle. Social media sites are falsely spreading an image of a young crying woman, claiming in various languages that Zelenskyy's daughter, Oleksandra Zelenska "hates her father" and had called him a "Nazi" and "murderer of the Ukrainian people."

259.title: Different venues are playing differently, it was tough to bowl vs MI: Samson
259.article_body: After they failed to defend their 158-run total against MI, RR captain Sanju Samson said it was tough to bowl during the second innings at the DY Patil Stadium. "We could've scored a few more runs. [Then] dew came in and it was tough to bowl...Different venues are playing in different ways. Batting first was tough...it was two-paced," he stated.

260.title: Pujara slams another double hundred in county cricket, scores 531 runs in 5 innings
260.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara smashed another double hundred for Sussex in a County Championship Division Two 2022 match against Durham. Pujara scored 203 runs off 334 deliveries in the first innings of the match. Pujara has now scored 531 runs in last five innings for Sussex. The 34-year-old batter has now smashed 15 double hundreds in first-class cricket.

261.title: 2 Bihar men caught with 150 kg marijuana in Nepal
261.article_body: Two men from Bihar were arrested for allegedly carrying 150 kg marijuana in Nepal's Bara district. The police said they seized the marijuana consignment consisting of 10 packets weighing 15 kg each, according to a report. The two - Ajit Paswan (35) and Ram Darshan Mahato (60) - were sent to judicial custody for further investigation by a court.

262.title: I've been working since I was 5; had no friends, childhood playful stuff: Neetu
262.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor said that she has been working since she was five years old. "So there were no friends. No childhood playful stuff at all. Then I started working with my husband [late actor Rishi Kapoor]," she said, adding that her career started with the actor and that they did 80 movies in seven years.

263.title: TN's Sri Lanka aid resolution shouldn't be for political mileage: BJP
263.article_body: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit wrote to state CM MK Stalin on Sunday saying that it welcomes the state assembly's resolution to seek permission from the Centre to provide humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka. However, it claimed that recently, the state government's actions were aimed at getting "political mileage" and it's "only afraid" this resolution shouldn't be for the same reason.

264.title: Chhattisgarh man hung upside down from tree and thrashed; 5 arrested
264.article_body: Five people were arrested after they allegedly hung a man upside down from a tree and thrashed him in Chhattisgarh. Police said accused Manish Khare, Shivraj Khare and Janu Bhargav were taken into custody on Friday while Bhim Kesarwani and 15-year-old boy were detained on Saturday. Police added Manish spotted victim trying to get into his house on April 26.

265.title: Ex-MLA PC George held for making controversial remarks against Muslims
265.article_body: Former MLA and senior Kerala politician, PC George, was taken into police custody for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims. The six-time MLA was booked under Section 153A of the IPC for allegedly making the remarks at an event organised by the Ananthapuri Hindu Maha Sammelan. The 70-year-old politician had alleged that tea sold in Muslim-run restaurants cause "impotence".

266.title: Imran Khan, 150 others booked over slogans against Pak PM in Saudi
266.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and 150 others were booked on Saturday after slogans of "chor-chor" (thief) and "gaddar" (traitor) were raised against the country's PM Shehbaz Sharif and his delegation on their way to Masjid-e-Nabawi in Saudi Arabia's Medina, officials said. A video of people sloganeering had surfaced online. The booked people include Khan's former cabinet members.

267.title: Price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder hiked by ₹102.50, will cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi
267.article_body: The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹102.50 on Sunday, reported ANI. The 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi, which was earlier priced at ₹2,253. In Mumbai, the commercial LPG price was hiked to ₹2,307 from ₹2,205 per cylinder. In Kolkata and Chennai, a 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,455 and ₹2,508 respectively.

268.title: Kohli's 58(53) was a huge step in the right direction: Du Plessis
268.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis has said Virat Kohli's 58-run innings against GT was a huge step in the "right direction". He added, "Cricket is a massive game of confidence and it'll be huge. To get a solid fifty, it's big for him and for us, something that we can take forward." It was Kohli's first fifty of IPL 2022.

269.title: Getting anxiety attacks almost every day, feels like impending doom: Aamir's daughter
269.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan took to Instagram to share that she is getting anxiety attacks almost every day. Adding that it feels like "impending doom", she wrote, "It feels pretty helpless. Because I really want to go to sleep (it usually happens at night for me) but I can't because it won't stop."

270.title: Economy is in shambles, but BJP more concerned about UCC: Owaisi
270.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP on domestic economic issues. "The country's economy is in shambles, passenger trains are being cancelled to transport coal, unemployment is rising but you're more concerned about the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)," Owaisi said. "Why is the Hindu Undivided Family tax rebate not there for Muslims and Christians?" the 52-year-old politician asked.

271.title: Had to recreate Times Square millimetre by millimetre: Rakeysh on Delhi-6 song
271.article_body: Filmmaker Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra said that when they were shooting for the song 'Dil Gira Dafatan' in the movie 'Delhi-6', they did not have the same tools like today. He said they had to improvise a lot. "We had to recreate Times Square millimetre by millimetre, with the help of Google Earth images," he added.

272.title: Govt plans to declare Delhi’s 1000-yr-old lake a national monument
272.article_body: Union Minister of State for Culture Arjun Ram Meghwal said that the government is planning to declare Delhi's Anang Tal lake, which is said to be about a thousand years old, as a national monument. During a visit to the site in South Delhi, Meghwal asked the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to expedite the restoration work of the lake.

273.title: No Muslim woman wants husband to get 3 other wives: Assam CM on UCC
273.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) isn't his issue but an "issue for all Muslim women". "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives," he added. To provide justice to Muslim women, triple talaq has to be removed and UCC needs to be brought in, he further said.

274.title: Mouni Roy recommends Astrotalk for marriage predictions
274.article_body: Mouni Roy recently collaborated with Astrotalk and praised the astrology app for serving 3 crore+ customers. She recommended people to chat with astrologers at Astrotalk to get accurate love, marriage, and career-related predictions. Astrotalk offers first chat with astrologers for free for people to try the app.

275.title: I refused a lot of male-centric, Khan or Kumar-led films: Kangana Ranaut
275.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she refused a lot of male-centric films. "[I refused many] Khan-led films or Kumar-led films [and] all kinds of big hero films," she added. When asked if she feels there is pay parity for female actors in the film industry, Kangana said, "I can say that I am not underpaid."

276.title: Big achievement: Chhavi as she visits salon at hospital after breast cancer surgery
276.article_body: Chhavi Mittal, who underwent surgery for breast cancer earlier this week, recently paid a visit to a salon at her hospital. Sharing a video of her salon visit on Saturday, she wrote, "Felt so proud of myself to walk to...salon...and sit there to get my hair washed...Big achievement." Chhavi added she also "took the most painful...but most refreshing shower today".

277.title: Anupam attends 'Khichdi' actor Anang Desai's son's wedding, shares pics
277.article_body: Anupam Kher recalled being college roommates with 'Khichdi' actor Anang Desai as he attended the wedding of the latter's son Nachiket. Sharing some pictures from Nachiket's wedding, Anupam wrote on Instagram that he and Anang shared a room in Delhi for three years when they attended National School of Drama. "To attend his and Chitra's son's...wedding...was pure joy," he added.

278.title: India reports 3,324 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases reach 19,092
278.article_body: India has reported 3,324 COVID-19 cases, 2,876 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,688 COVID-19 cases and 50 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,092, while the death toll rose to 5,23,843.

279.title: Madras High Court declares Mother Nature as a 'Living Being'
279.article_body: Madras High Court has used the "parens patriae jurisdiction" to declare Mother Nature as a 'Living Being', with all the rights, duties and liabilities of a living person, to help conserve and preserve it. Indiscriminate destruction of nature will cause several complications in ecosystem, the court observed. The court also directed the state and central government to protect Mother Nature.

280.title: Ashwin's wife consoles Rohit's wife after spinner dismisses MI captain, video goes viral
280.article_body: RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's wife Prithi consoled MI captain Rohit Sharma's wife Ritika after Ashwin dismissed Rohit in their IPL 2022 match on Saturday. Rohit was dismissed by the spinner for two runs off five deliveries in the third over of MI's innings. MI, however, went on to win the match by five wickets.

281.title: Lord Ram had bow, Yogi Adityanath has bulldozer: Sakshi Maharaj
281.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Sakshi Maharaj said, "While Lord Ram and Krishna had 'dhanush' (bow) and 'sudarshan chakra' respectively, our baba (Yogi Adityanath) has a bulldozer, which is being used against land mafia." Meanwhile, talking about leaders of opposition parties visiting Samajwadi Party's Azam Khan in Sitapur jail, he said, "I'm keeping an eye on it...and government...is aware of it."

282.title: Directors I worked with wanted short & sexy clothes for heroines: Manish Malhotra
282.article_body: Speaking about his journey in Bollywood, designer Manish Malhotra said he "really came into the limelight" after working with director Ram Gopal Varma on 'Rangeela'. Manish revealed that such types of clothes became a trend after he designed Urmila Matondkar's clothes in 'Rangeela'. He added the directors he was working with wanted clothes that were glamorous, sexy and short.

283.title: Scrap godown in Hyderabad catches fire, no casualties reported
283.article_body: A godown of scrap goods in Hyderabad's Musheerabad area caught fire on Saturday. Three fire tenders were rushed to the spot after the incident was reported by the locals at around 8 pm. According to the officials, no casualties have been reported yet and it is suspected that a short circuit could be the cause of the fire accident.

284.title: K'taka institute announces free education for kids of Kashmiri Pandits
284.article_body: Convener of Ambika Mahavidyalaya in Karnataka has announced free education for children of Kashmiri Pandits. "It will cost up to Rs 80,000 per student for a year to get education in this institute. The other facilities would cost them Rs 50,000 annually. But all facilities would be freely available to the children of Kashmiri Pandits," he added.

285.title: Burden is off Jadeja's shoulders: Ajay Jadeja on Dhoni returning as CSK captain
285.article_body: Former India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja will be relieved after handing over the CSK captaincy back to MS Dhoni. He added, "If Dhoni is in the team, he must be the captain. Everyone is happy...the burden is off [Jadeja's] shoulders now." CSK lost six of their first eight matches in IPL 2022 under Ravindra Jadeja.

286.title: There was romance in films, husband was not comfortable with it: Bhagyashree
286.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that her husband Himalay Dassani was not comfortable with her getting involved in films because they had romance in it. "The kind of films that were being made and having a very possessive husband, it gave a lesser spectrum of films that I could have worked on without him," she added.

287.title: Pune won't face water cuts as monsoon expected on time: PMC
287.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation said that the city won't face any water supply cuts as there is sufficient stock in four dams and monsoon is expected to arrive on time. The water stock in four dams - Panshet, Warasgaon, Khadakwasla and Temghar - was at 36% capacity on Saturday. The stock is adequate for the next one month, said an official.

288.title: Man poses as govt officer, cheats woman of ₹89 lakh in Bengaluru
288.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested in Bengaluru after he allegedly cheated a woman of ₹89 lakh by posing as an Intelligence Bureau officer. The man had told the woman that her passport was on a blacklist and that she'd been booked for "suspected terrorist activities act", according to police. The accused had reportedly promised to help her clear her name.

289.title: Man confronts girlfriend over affair, his friend gets killed in Pune
289.article_body: A 21-year-old man, Ganesh Ravindra Gaikwad, was stabbed to death after he accompanied his friend, Rahul Valanj, who wanted to confront his alleged girlfriend over suspicion of an affair in Pune. The girl called her uncle when Valanj confronted her at the shop where she worked. The uncle came with a few men and stabbed Gaikwad during a violent fight.

290.title: Our real potential came out against RR: Rohit on 1st win of IPL 2022
290.article_body: After MI defeated RR by five wickets to register their first win of the ongoing IPL season, captain Rohit Sharma said their "real potential" came out in the match. He added, "We were [also] not blown away by the opposition [in the previous games], we came really close. Had we won those games, things would have been slightly different."

291.title: Old Ramzan parking sign goes viral, Hyd police asks to not believe it
291.article_body: IPS AV Ranganath took to Twitter to share a notice from the Hyderabad Traffic Police, requesting the public to not believe an old Ramzan parking signage. "2014 parking signage related post [is] being viral every year during Ramzan season, circulating on Social Media 'Ramzan Mubarak-Vehicle Parking For Musallis'...request all citizens not to believe such postings and not circulate," post read.

292.title: Man pours petrol on lit pyre, causes explosion in Pune; 11 injured
292.article_body: As many as 11 people were injured after a man allegedly poured petrol over a lit pyre, causing an explosion, during a funeral at a crematorium in Pune on Saturday. The man wanted to "fasten the burning process", according to a police official. At least 80 people were present at the crematorium for the funeral, the deceased's family member said.

293.title: Electric scooter catches fire in Tamil Nadu, owner escapes by jumping off burning vehicle
293.article_body: An electric scooter caught fire in Hosur, an industrial hub in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district, on Saturday causing panic in the area, PTI reported. The owner, Satish Kumar, a supervisor at a Bengaluru firm, escaped after he jumped down from the burning scooter. Kumar had bought the vehicle last year. Recently, multiple reports of electric scooters catching fire have surfaced.

294.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Saturday released
294.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 44°C or more as their maximum temperature on Saturday. Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded the highest maximum temperature at 46.6°C, followed by Bramhapuri (46.3°C). Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Jharkhand's Daltonganj recorded maximum temperature of 46°C each. Jaisalmer recorded maximum temperature of 45.9°C.

295.title: Ate only chana for a week to wear clothes designed by Manish Malhotra: Twinkle
295.article_body: Recalling an incident from the movie 'Baadshah', actress Twinkle Khanna said that she ate only chana for a week. "This is what you had to do to wear your clothes," she said in an interview with designer Manish Malhotra. Malhotra said that young directors wanted the clothes to be "glamorous and sexy".

296.title: Hero Electric dispatched zero vehicles in April amid chip shortage
296.article_body: Hero Electric, India's largest electric two-wheeler manufacturer by volume, has reported zero dispatches in April 2022 due to the global chip shortage. "It's like putting an emergency brake on a fast-moving train. Our sales were almost doubling month on month and we somehow managed...but the (Russia-Ukraine) war collapsed a major supply chain, resulting in this disruption," CEO Sohinder Gill said.

297.title: MI beat RR in last over to register their 1st win in IPL 2022 after 8 losses in a row
297.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) defeated Rajasthan Royals (RR) by five wickets in the last over on Saturday to register theri first victory in IPL 2022 after eight consecutive losses. With the win, MI ended RR's three-match winning streak. Suryakumar Yadav top-scored for MI with 51(39), while MI's Hrithik Shokeen and Riley Meredith took two wickets each in the match.

298.title: Will loudspeaker demand solve unemployment issue?: Sharad Pawar
298.article_body: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made "to take the country backwards in the name of caste and religion". Hinting at Raj Thackeray's demand to remove loudspeakers from mosques, Sharad Pawar questioned if this would solve unemployment. Pawar's comment comes ahead of the MNS chief's visit to Aurangabad, where he will address the issue.

299.title: Law & order deteriorating in Punjab: Anurag Thakur on Patiala clash
299.article_body: Condemning the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over the clashes that broke out in Patiala, Punjab, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that it reflects the deteriorating law and order situation in the state. "Even before polls, questions were raised about the intentions and capabilities of AAP," Thakur said. He questioned if AAP would take action against those trying to disrupt peace.

300.title: Andhra Education Minister must resign: TDP on class 10 exam paper leak
300.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP), which is the main Opposition party in Andhra Pradesh, demanded the resignation of the state's Education Minister Botcha Satyanarayana over the class 10 exam paper leak case. The TDP also questioned why the CM was 'silent' over the issue. "They [YSRCP] were playing dangerous games with the lives of lakhs of students," a TDP leader said.

301.title: Will prove majority in Parliament next week: Sri Lankan Opp'n
301.article_body: A leader of the Sri Lankan Opposition said that his party, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), will prove its majority in Parliament next week during a no-confidence motion. "President should resign...and...constitutional reforms should follow to ensure checks and balances among...pillars of the government," Lakshman Kiriella added. The political instability began amid an economic crisis in the country.

302.title: Massive fire breaks out in forest of J&K's Rajouri amid heatwave
302.article_body: As Jammu and Kashmir continues to reel under a heatwave, a massive fire broke out in different forest areas of Rajouri on Saturday. Images showed clouds of smoke billowing from the forest area. This fire was reported a few days after a fire broke out in the forest area in the Reasi district, destroying trees and other forest materials.

303.title: ₹105-cr greenfield grain-based ethanol plant inaugurated in Bihar
303.article_body: A ₹105-crore greenfield grain-based ethanol plant was inaugurated by Bihar CM Nitish Kumar in Purnea on Saturday. It's India's first such plant and was developed under Bihar Ethanol Production Promotion Policy 2021, according to a tweet by the CM's official account. Speaking on the occasion, the CM said that ethanol production will help reduce petrol costs and generate employment.

304.title: PM Shehbaz Sharif's son takes oath as CM of Pakistan's Punjab
304.article_body: Hamza Shehbaz, son of Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday took the oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab. The oath of office was administered to him by National Assembly Speaker Raja Pervaiz Ashraf at the Governor House in Lahore. Notably, PM Shehbaz had served as Punjab CM three times, with his third term lasting from 2013 to 2018.

305.title: Amber Heard called it a practical joke gone wrong: Depp's guard on defecation in bed
305.article_body: Johnny Depp's security guard Starling Jenkins said Amber Heard called faeces found in the couple's bed a "horrible practical joke gone wrong", a court heard. He described how he had driven Heard to Coachella and had a conversation pertaining to "the surprise she had left in the boss' bed". Asked what he was referring to, he replied, "The defecation."

306.title: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara & husband accused of having sex with 13-yr-old girl
306.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara Phythian and her husband Victor Marke have been accused of sexually abusing a minor and 'threatening to smash her kneecaps if she told anyone'. The survivor, now a woman, told the court she was abused from ages 13 to 15. She alleged that Phythian told her to have oral sex with Marke.

307.title: RR's Ashwin has been a mystery bowler in IPL 2022: Dasgupta
307.article_body: Calling Ravichandran Ashwin a "mystery bowler" in IPL 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said the RR off-spinner is using different variations and has been a revelation to a great extent. "Until now, he has not bowled his traditional off-spinners on very less occasions and has instead used a carrom ball and flippers," he added.

308.title: Parked private school bus catches fire in Jammu, no one injured
308.article_body: A bus belonging to a private school in Jammu caught fire while it was parked inside the school premises on Saturday. "We noticed smoke in the bus which might be due to a technical fault or heat. The fire was controlled in half an hour," school officials said. The buses parked near it were removed and no injuries were reported.

309.title: Pak aims to double hydroelectric output in 7 yrs amid power shortage
309.article_body: Pakistan aims to double its hydroelectric output in the next seven years to meet the rising power demand in the country, a state media report said. The country is reeling under a worsening energy crisis, resulting in up to 10-18 hours of load-shedding in parts of the country. Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif blamed the previous government for the current situation.

310.title: Pics show wreckage left behind on Mars by NASA rover
310.article_body: NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter snapped pictures showing the parachute that helped the agency's Perseverance rover land on Mars and the cone-shaped backshell that protected the rover in deep space and during its descent. "Many of...the 80 high-strength suspension lines connecting the backshell to the parachute are visible and appear intact," wrote NASA. The rover landed on Mars in February 2021.

311.title: IDFC FIRST Bank's Q4 profit rises 168% year-on-year to ₹343 crore
311.article_body: IDFC FIRST Bank reported that its net profit for the quarter ended March 2022 surged 168% to ₹343 crore as compared to ₹128 crore in the year-ago period. This was driven by strong growth in core operating income and lower provisioning, the bank said. IDFC's profit for financial year 2021-22 stood at ₹145 crore, marking a year-on-year decline of 68%.

312.title: He's gone, done it again: Swann on Tewatia's 25-ball 43* vs RCB
312.article_body: Praising GT batter Rahul Tewatia for his 25-ball 43* in the side's six-wicket win against RCB in IPL 2022, Graeme Swann took to Twitter and wrote, "He's gone and done it again!! Tewatia amazing stuff." Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Tewatia keeps punishing those length deliveries. Plays to his strength and keeps delivering for GT." He was adjudged "Player of the Match".

313.title: Beijing bans dine-in services during holidays in May to curb outbreak
313.article_body: Authorities in China's capital Beijing have banned dine-in services during the Labour Day holidays in May to curb the spread of COVID-19. The decision comes after the city began mass testing millions of residents earlier this week amid a coronavirus outbreak. The restaurants have been ordered to only provide takeout services from Sunday to Wednesday.

314.title: Longewala border post in Raj to be turned into tourist attraction
314.article_body: The Rajasthan government and Border Security Force (BSF) are working to develop the Longewala border post in Jaisalmer into a tourist attraction along with Tanot Mata Temple and Kishangarh Fort. Tourists will be allowed to visit the Bavaliyawala border and watch the retreat ceremony. Meanwhile, BSF documentaries, weapons and a photo gallery will be displayed at the Tanot base.

315.title: Football superagent Mino Raiola, who represented Pogba & Ibrahimovic, passes away aged 54
315.article_body: Football superagent Mino Raiola passed away aged 54 on Saturday after battling a serious illness since January. Raiola represented footballers including Paul Pogba, Erling Haaland, Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Gianluigi Donnarumma, Matthijs de Ligt and Mario Balotelli. "Mino fought until the end with the same strength he put on negotiation tables to defend our players," Raiola's family said in a statement.

316.title: There's peace as of now: Punjab CM after Patiala clashes
316.article_body: A day after clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala over an anti-Khalistan march, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said, "There's peace in [the city] as of now". "Shiv Sena, Congress and Shiromani Akali Dal...workers clashed with each other," he said. Police officials have been transferred and peace committee meetings are being conducted, he added.

317.title: Is Nehru ji to blame for PM Modi's failure?: Rahul on power crisis
317.article_body: Criticising PM Narendra Modi over the ongoing power crisis in India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday asked if he would be blaming "Nehru ji or states or people" for his "failure". He also shared a video of an earlier speech by the PM in which he promised 24-hour electricity, writing, "PM's promises and intentions have always been disconnected."

318.title: Real Madrid win record-extending 35th La Liga title
318.article_body: Real Madrid on Saturday clinched a record-extending 35th La Liga title after defeating Espanyol 4-0. Rodrygo scored twice, while Marco Asensio and Karim Benzema added a goal each to give Real Madrid their second league title in three seasons, and third in six years. Real Madrid won the title with four league matches remaining in the season.

319.title: I'm happy but never satisfied: PBKS' Arshdeep on his form in IPL 2022
319.article_body: Talking about his performance in ongoing IPL, PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh said he's happy but never satisfied. "My plan has always been to bowl in good areas and let the batter make mistakes...in death overs I just try to keep things simple," he added. Arshdeep has so far taken three wickets from nine matches at an economy rate of 7.70.

320.title: DSP injured in gunfight with drug traffickers in Assam, 2 arrested
320.article_body: Assam Police said that Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Headquarters, Anurag Sarmah was injured during a gunfight with alleged drug traffickers in Goalpara, Assam. Police said that two drug traffickers were arrested and drugs were seized from them. During a routine check, the police team directed the two bikers to stop, but they tried to flee, the police added.

321.title: Poll announcement soon?: Kejriwal on reports of Guj BJP leaders meeting PM
321.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday took to Twitter and asked if the BJP is going to announce fresh elections in Gujarat after dissolving the Gujarat assembly next week. Kejriwal's statement comes as PM Narendra Modi reportedly held a meeting with Gujarat BJP leaders in Delhi on Saturday. "Are they so scared of AAP?" Kejriwal added.

322.title: BJP mismanaging power crisis like COVID-19: Congress' Kamal Nath
322.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath condemned the BJP in Madhya Pradesh and at the Centre over the power crisis and accused the party of taking the issue lightly, saying the crisis was being 'mismanaged like COVID-19'. "This is the consequence of the corruption they (BJP) have done in the last two years," he said. BJP is denying the crisis, he added.

323.title: Serbia showcases its Chinese missile system amid concerns in West
323.article_body: Serbia on Saturday publicly displayed the new surface-to-air missile system it purchased from China, amid concerns among its neighbours and the West over peace in the region. Serbia is currently the only European country to operate the FK-3 system. The Chinese system is similar to the American Patriot and the Russian S-300 surface-to-air missile systems, according to several reports.

324.title: Turkey, Saudi Arabia to revive great economic potential: Turkish Prez
324.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Saturday said that Turkey and Saudi Arabia have a common will to reactivate a great economic potential between them. Erdoğan made the comment after his first trip to the Gulf kingdom since 2017. Saudi funding could help Turkey alleviate its economic woes ahead of the presidential election next year, according to analysts and officials.

325.title: Same Xiaomi allowed to donate ₹10 cr to PM-CARES Fund: Moitra on ED seizure
325.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Saturday reacted to the Enforcement Directorate's seizure of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore over Forex law violations. Moitra said the same Xiaomi was earlier "allowed to donate ₹10 crore to opaque PM-CARES Fund". Notably, Congress had earlier questioned why PM Modi's COVID-19 fund was accepting donations from Chinese companies.

326.title: Man poses as CM & tries to cheat MLA in Raj to fund girlfriend's hobbies, arrested
326.article_body: A 28-year-old computer engineer was arrested from Andhra Pradesh after he tried to cheat an MLA in Rajasthan of ₹30,000 by posing as CM Ashok Gehlot, police said. The man, who had earlier cheated two ministers and 3 MLAs in Andhra Pradesh of ₹1.80 crore in 2019, used the loot to fund his girlfriend's expensive hobbies, police added.

327.title: Dhoni leading CSK again might seem like deja vu, but it's Jadeja vu: Jaffer
327.article_body: After MS Dhoni was reappointed as CSK skipper, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "The feeling we're all going to experience seeing Dhoni lead CSK again might seem like deja vu, but it's in fact [Ravindra] Jadeja vu." Jadeja decided to relinquish the captaincy on Saturday. He led defending champions CSK in eight matches in IPL 2022, winning only two of them.

328.title: Temperature crosses 45°C-mark at 9 places in Rajasthan; IMD issues alert
328.article_body: The maximum temperature at nine places in Rajasthan crossed the 45°C-mark on Saturday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for heatwave in Jhunjhunu, Alwar, Bharatpur, Dholpur, Dungarpur and Banswara till May 3. The department has also issued an orange alert for Bikaner, Barmer, Churu, Jaisalmer, Jodhpur and Sri Ganganagar for the same duration.

329.title: Shaw shares 'amazing sentence in English' post for Tharoor; MP corrects spelling
329.article_body: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted a post titled 'an amazing sentence in English' and wrote, "Something for Shashi Tharoor's amusement!" It claimed that the person who wrote the sentence, which is a rhopalic sentence, must be a vocabulary genius. Responding to Shaw, Congress MP wrote, "Alas, Kiran, "incomprehensibleness" is not a word. It's "incomprehensibility", and that's only 19 letters."

330.title: Russian state TV shows how nuclear strike can hit London, Paris in 200 seconds
330.article_body: A Russian state TV simulated nuclear strikes on Europe, claiming the nuclear bombs would hit Paris, Berlin and London in around 200 seconds. The hosts claimed that there would be "no survivors" in the strikes. This comes as the Russian invasion of Ukraine continues after beginning in late February.

331.title: 9 'illegal' shops owned by Congress leader bulldozed in MP
331.article_body: Nine shops owned by Congress leader Pankaj Ahirwar in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh were demolished using bulldozers on Saturday as part of the BJP-led government's drive against encroachment. According to the administration, the shops in front of the Collectorate were constructed illegally on government land. The SDM, Tehsildar and administrative staff were in attendance during the demolition.

332.title: Zerodha's profits grew over 50% in 2021-22, thanks to bull run: CEO
332.article_body: Stockbroking firm Zerodha recorded more than 50% jump in revenue and profitability for 2021-22, its CEO Nithin Kamath said. Thanking the liquidity-driven bull run in markets, Kamath explained that a shift to work from home, increased savings, bull market, volatility, IPOs, and India stack led to significant growth in the unicorn startup's investor base in the last two years.

333.title: Action must be taken if loudspeaker is used to provoke: Kamal Nath
333.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath, spoke on the issue of loudspeakers on Saturday, saying that it is a "private matter" and "should not be made a public issue because peoples' sentiments are attached to it". He however stated that the loudspeakers shouldn't be misused and that action must be taken "if loudspeakers are used with the intention of provoking".

334.title: Great Indian Reader: Tharoor on fan's pic of collection of books written by him
334.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday reacted to a picture of a huge stack of books authored by him that was shared by a fan of his. "Added all the new ones to my Shashi Tharoor corner," the fan wrote while sharing the picture. "Wow! Now there's a Great Indian Reader!" Tharoor responded.

335.title: Pant has great cricketing mind, he'll captain Team India soon: WV Raman
335.article_body: Ex-India Women's coach WV Raman said DC skipper Rishabh Pant has the potential to captain Team India in future. "For now, he has to learn the ropes in the next one and two years as far as captaincy is concerned," he added. "Pant has a great cricketing mind, but he is on a learning curve," he further said.

336.title: BCom student in MP dies by suicide after appearing for exam
336.article_body: A 22-year-old BCom student in MP allegedly died by suicide on Saturday after appearing for an exam. The victim returned home around 3 pm and later locked herself in another room where she was found dead, police said, adding a suicide note wasn't found. Her sisters believe she took the step due to exam pressure.

337.title: Angelina Jolie spotted at a cafe in Ukraine amid war; video surfaces
337.article_body: Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie was spotted at a cafe in Ukraine's Lviv on Saturday, with several people sharing her video online. Another video showed her talking to people at a train station in the city amid Russia-Ukraine war. While her visit has not been announced officially, a Belarusian advisor claimed she arrived in Ukraine as part of the UNHCR's mission.

338.title: Delhi records 1,520 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death, positivity rate at 5%
338.article_body: Delhi on Saturday recorded 1,520 fresh COVID-19 infections, as compared to 1,607 infections recorded in the national capital on Friday. One person died of the virus in the last 24 hours in Delhi while 1,412 people recovered in the same period. The city's daily positivity rate was at 5.10% on Saturday as compared to 5.28% on Friday.

339.title: Jack Dorsey, Peter Thiel encouraged Musk to take Twitter private: WSJ
339.article_body: A group of "libertarian-leaning activists and businessmen", PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel, and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey encouraged Elon Musk to take Twitter private, the Wall Street Journal reported. Musk and Dorsey believed Twitter could be run more effectively as a private company and they focussed on its role as a potential public good, the WSJ said, quoting former executives.

340.title: Russian forces hit 389 targets in Ukraine overnight: Russia
340.article_body: Russian artillery units had struck 389 Ukrainian targets overnight, Russia said on Saturday. The targets included 35 control points, 15 arms and ammunition depots and several areas where Ukrainian troops and equipment were concentrated. Notably, Ukraine said that Russia had failed to capture three target areas in Ukraine's Donbas region despite several strikes by Russian forces.

341.title: Mohammad Shami's gesture after Virat Kohli's fifty goes viral
341.article_body: GT fast bowler Mohammad Shami's gesture after RCB batter Virat Kohli scored his maiden fifty in IPL 2022 has gone viral. Following the last ball of the over in which Kohli reached his half-century, Shami was seen patting Kohli's back and putting his arm around Kohli's shoulder to appreciate his knock. "What a lovely moment," a fan commented.

342.title: 3 accused arrested, 24 identified after violent clashes in Patiala
342.article_body: Three accused have been arrested a day after violent clashes broke out in Punjab's Patiala, police said. Patiala SSP Deepak Parik said that around 24 other accused have been identified and special teams have been formed to arrest them. He added that curfew, which was imposed following the clashes, has been lifted and internet services have been restored in Patiala.

343.title: K'taka Home Minister should resign: Ex-CM on PSI recruitment scam
343.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah demanded the resignation of state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra a day after the Karnataka government announced its decision to annul the PSI recruitment exam and conduct a re-examination. "On what moral grounds can (Jnanendra) continue as Home Minister?" he tweeted. He also sought Karnataka CM's clarification over the government's decision to re-conduct the exam.

344.title: Centre's help needed to develop border areas: Arunachal Pradesh Min
344.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Home Minister Bamang Felix on Saturday said, "Infrastructural and economic development of our border areas...requires constant efforts and interventions by the Union government." The topography and sparsely populated regions with limited infrastructure pose a challenge to connectivity, he added. Notably, Arunachal Pradesh shares a land border with China, Bhutan and Myanmar.

345.title: You were silent on WB post-poll violence: Ex-bureaucrats to group that criticised PM
345.article_body: Responding to 108 ex-bureaucrats who questioned PM Narendra Modi's "silence" on recent incidents of communal violence, 197 ex-bureaucrats and judges said the group maintained a "studied silence" over post-poll violence in West Bengal. "It lays bare their cynical, unprincipled approach to issues," said the open letter. Major communal violence incidents have reduced under BJP government, it claimed.

346.title: Hardik looking exactly how Rohit was when he became MI captain: Gavaskar
346.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said the role of captaincy is doing the same thing to GT's Hardik Pandya as it did to Rohit Sharma in 2013 when he was appointed the MI skipper. He added the responsibility transformed Rohit into an improved batter and a leader and Hardik is showing the same qualities. GT are presently placed on top of the standings.

347.title: Ensure coal availability at power plants: Chhattisgarh CM to Centre
347.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that the Centre should ensure the availability of coal at power plants across India amid the power crisis. Baghel's comment came after the Ministry of Power released a statement saying the country was facing a power crisis wherein the peak power demand for electricity touched an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW on Friday.

348.title: Naby Keita scores to send Liverpool top of Premier League in 1-0 win
348.article_body: Naby Keita scored on Saturday to send Liverpool to the top of the Premier League table with a 1-0 win over Newcastle United. Keita scored in the 19th minute. Liverpool now have a two-point lead over Manchester City who play later on Saturday. Liverpool will face Villarreal in the second-leg of their Champions League semi-final on Tuesday.

349.title: Part of under-construction bridge over Ganga collapses in Bihar; CM orders probe
349.article_body: A section of an under-construction four-lane bridge, which was being built at a cost of ₹1,710 crore, over river Ganga linking Sultanganj and Khagaria in Bihar collapsed on Saturday early morning. "The collapse of the superstructure raises questions on the quality of construction," a JD(U) MLA said. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has ordered an inquiry into the matter.

350.title: MP caught watching porn in UK parliament resigns, calls it 'moment of madness'
350.article_body: UK MP Neil Parish has resigned after he was caught watching porn on his phone while sitting alongside a female member in UK parliament. Parish said the first time he looked at porn, it was accidental, but admitted that the second time was deliberate. Calling it a "moment of madness", he said, "I wasn't proud of what I was doing."

351.title: Fuelling politics of hate: Ex-bureaucrats respond to open letter criticising PM
