351.article_body: Some 197 former judges and bureaucrats have responded to an open letter by a group of 108 ex-bureaucrats who had criticised PM Narendra Modi's "silence" amid a "frenzy of hate-filled destruction". "Their 'anger' is...empty virtue-signalling...they're fuelling the politics of hate they seek to combat by attempting to engineer hate against the government with...false portrayals," said the group.

352.title: Table-toppers GT win their 5th match in a row, RCB suffer 3rd straight defeat
352.article_body: Table-toppers Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) by six wickets to register their fifth straight victory in IPL 2022. RCB have now lost three matches in a row. GT chased down the 171-run target in the 20th over. It was the fifth time that GT finished a successful run chase in the 20th over in IPL 2022.

353.title: India has 4 crore pending court cases: Chief Justice of India
353.article_body: India has more than 4 crore cases pending in lower courts, Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said on Saturday. "We have 20 judges per 10 lakh people, which is highly inadequate to deal with the rising trend of litigation," the CJI stated. He said this during a conference attended by PM Narendra Modi and Chief Ministers.

354.title: BJP trying to divide Hindus in Maha: Uddhav amid Hanuman Chalisa row
354.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday accused BJP of trying to divide Hindus in the state. Thackeray said, "It is the BJP's conspiracy to divide Hindus and Marathis and non-Marathis in Maharashtra." His remarks came amid the controversy surrounding MP-MLA couple Navneet Rana and Ravi, who were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Thackeray's home.

355.title: 6-storey building housing hotel, flats collapses in China; 23 trapped, 39 missing
355.article_body: At least 39 people are missing and 23 are trapped after a six-storey building collapsed in China's Hunan province, officials said on Saturday. At least five people have been rescued so far, Chinese Media reported. The owner of the property, which housed restaurant, a cafe, a family-run hotel and flats, has been detained over suspicion of illegal construction.

356.title: Our royalty payments, bank statements are legit: Xiaomi as ED seizes ₹5,551 cr
356.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore "in connection with illegal outward remittances", the company said, "As a brand committed to India, all our operations are firmly compliant with local laws and regulations." Xiaomi further said, "We believe our royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful."

357.title: Gorakhnath Temple attack accused was in touch with ISIS fighters: UP Police
357.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar on Saturday said that Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, the accused in the Gorakhnath Temple attack case, was in contact with ISIS fighters and sympathisers through social media. Kumar also claimed that the accused had sent around ₹8.5 lakh as well as various arms to many countries to support ISIS terror activities.

358.title: Van de Zandschulp beats world no. 7 Ruud to reach SFs of BMW Open
358.article_body: Botic van de Zandschulp on Friday beat world number seven Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-1 to reach the semi-finals of the BMW Open in Munich. "[The] second set was a little bit easier, but I think I played really well today," the 26-year-old said. Van de Zandschulp also beat Ruud, a seven-time ATP Tour winner, at the US Open last year.

359.title: Ravindra Jadeja hands over CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni
359.article_body: Ravindra Jadeja has decided to relinquish captaincy to focus and concentrate more on his game and has requested MS Dhoni to lead CSK, the franchise said. Dhoni has accepted to lead CSK in the larger interest and to allow Jadeja to focus on his game, it added. CSK have lost six of their first eight matches in IPL 2022.

360.title: RCB need a minimum of 3 wins in next 5 league matches: Jaffer
360.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said that RCB would be demoralised after their batting order collapsed in the last two matches in IPL 2022. He added that they need a minimum of three wins in the next five league matches. "They don't want to be in a must-win situation," he further said. RCB are currently on a two-match losing streak.

361.title: Matt Judge resigns as Man Utd director of football negotiations
361.article_body: Matt Judge has resigned as Manchester United's director of football negotiations. Judge has been in charge of transfer and contract negotiations at the club over the past eight years. He is currently serving a notice period before departing later this year. Judge was appointed by Ed Woodward, the club's former executive vice-chairman who left in February of this year.

362.title: MI to bowl first against RR, MI make 2 changes to their playing XI
362.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. MI have included Tim David and Kumar Kartikeya in their playing XI. RR have not made any changes to their playing XI. RR have won three matches in a row in IPL 2022.

363.title: N Korea to launch pre-emptive nuclear strike if threatened, says Kim
363.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has warned that North Korea could launch a pre-emptive nuclear strike if threatened. Kim made the comments as he praised military officials over the staging of parade in Pyongyang on Monday, which marked the 90th anniversary of the army's founding. Notably, North Korea has conducted 13 rounds of weapons launches so far this year.

364.title: Hyderabad man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing daughter
364.article_body: A 33-year-old man from Hyderabad's Kamatipura area was reportedly sentenced to rigorous life imprisonment for killing his six-month-old daughter in 2015. The accused, Md Saleem, was also asked to pay a fine of ₹25,000. According to a complaint by Saleem's wife, he slammed the infant against a sofa during an altercation, after which the baby became unresponsive.

365.title: 15 wagons of goods train carrying coal derails in UP; restoration work underway
365.article_body: Fifteen wagons of a goods train carrying coal, which was on its way to Haryana's Kalanaur, derailed at the new Ekdil railway station of the Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor (DFC) near Uttar Pradesh's Etawah on Saturday. The freight train track was blocked following the incident, while the passenger train route was not affected. Work for restoration has reportedly started.

366.title: Will take strict action against disruptors of peace in Punjab: Kejriwal
366.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that strict action will be taken against those who will disrupt the peace of Punjab. His remarks came a day after stones were hurled and swords were brandished when clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala. Notably, the Punjab government has transferred Patiala IG, SSP and SP following the clashes.

367.title: Joe Biden laughs at himself after fumbling on 'kleptocracy', video surfaces
367.article_body: A video has shown US President Joe Biden fumbling over the word 'kleptocracy' during a speech. Biden is heard saying, "We're going to seize [Russian oligarchs'] yachts, luxury homes and other ill-begotten gains of (Russian President Vladimir) Putin's kleptoc- yeah- kleptocracy and klep- the guys who are the kleptocracies." He's heard laughing at himself, saying, "But these are bad guys."

368.title: He's using RR's bowling group brilliantly: Hayden on skipper Samson
368.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden said RR have the best bowling line-up in ongoing IPL, adding their skipper Sanju Samson is rotating the bowlers brilliantly. "Despite coin toss not going in...favour of Samson (on so many occasions), his bowlers are accessing some fantastic areas," he added. RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal is currently the leading wicket-taker with 18 wickets from 8 matches.

369.title: People throw notes in theatre during Sonu Sood's entry scene in Acharya, he shares video
369.article_body: Sonu Sood on Saturday shared a video of fans throwing notes during his entry scene in the film 'Acharya', which stars Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan in the lead roles. "Thank you so much to my lovely fans who I proudly call my family...I don't deserve this kind of love, but your kindness keeps me going to do better," he wrote.

370.title: CL qualification would be ‘important achievement’ for Arsenal: Arteta
370.article_body: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said securing Champions League qualification this season would be "an important achievement" for the club. Arsenal are currently in fourth place on the Premier League table with five games to play. Arsenal finished in eighth place last season. Arsenal will face seventh-placed West Ham United next in the Premier League on Sunday.

371.title: 14-year-old boy drowns in private swimming pool in MP's Betul
371.article_body: A 14-year-old boy drowned in a private swimming pool in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district on Friday. Vinay Likhitkar had come to BRC Club's pool to meet some family members, who have club membership, police said. He, however, entered the pool himself and drowned after going into the deeper side. He was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead.

372.title: ₹1,500 per acre bonus for farmers opting for direct seeding of rice: Punjab CM
372.article_body: The Punjab government on Saturday announced ₹1,500 per acre as financial assistance to farmers opting for direct seeding of rice (DSR) technique in the upcoming paddy season. Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said farmers can start sowing paddy using this method from May 20. "If we use the DSR technique...we can save groundwater for our future generations," he added.

373.title: Russia stole several hundred thousand tonnes of grain: Ukraine
373.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Agriculture Minister Taras Vysotsky on Saturday said that Russian forces have stolen "several hundred thousand tonnes" of grain in areas of Ukraine they occupy. Vysotsky claimed that most of 1.5 million tonnes of grain stored in occupied territory could also be stolen by Russian forces. Ukraine was one of the world's biggest exporters of grain before the invasion.

374.title: Birthday wishes to only batsman who's given me nightmares: Gambhir to Rohit
374.article_body: Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to wish India captain Rohit Sharma on his 35th birthday on Saturday. "Greetings to the only batsman who has given me nightmares as a captain. Thankfully I don't captain anymore," he wrote. Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Happy birthday brotherman, this is the time to back yourself and hit it out of...park like you always have."

375.title: JD(U) doesn't interfere in religion: Bihar CM on loudspeaker issue
375.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday spoke about the BJP's demand for the removal of loudspeakers from religious places, saying, "Everyone's aware of [JD(U)'s] view, we never do any sort of interference in any religion." BJP leader Janak Ram earlier said that if a law on loudspeakers has come into UP, it'll have its effect in Bihar as well.

376.title: Mother & stepfather force teen into prostitution in MP, arrested
376.article_body: Police in MP's Gwalior have arrested the mother and stepfather of a 13-year-old girl, for allegedly forcing her into prostitution. The pair had pushed the girl into a room and locked her with two people who allegedly went on to rape her regularly and were charged money by the stepfather. The other two accused have also been arrested.

377.title: Time to create National Judicial Infrastructure Authority: CJI
377.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday said that a National Judicial Infrastructure Authority has to be established for the standardisation and improvement of judicial infrastructure. The authority would have representation from all the stakeholders, including the representatives of central and state governments, he added. The CJI also flagged several key problems faced by the judiciary.

378.title: IPL debutants GT remind me of RR of 2008 under Warne: Pietersen
378.article_body: Ex-England skipper Kevin Pietersen said watching IPL debutants GT in ongoing season reminds him of RR, when they won the title under late Shane Warne in 2008. "They are consistently finding ways to win, whether from a good, middling or bad position in games," he added. Having lost only one match this season, GT are currently on top of standings.

379.title: Man City’s Guardiola praises ‘devastating’ playmaker Kevin De Bruyne
379.article_body: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola praised playmaker Kevin De Bruyne as "devastating" and the best in the world in his position. "He can run and break the space for the opponent. It's devastating. He is really, really good," Guardiola said. De Bruyne has registered 15 goals and 12 assists in 40 games for City so far this season.

380.title: List of largest Russian fuel importers after war released; US larger buyer than India
380.article_body: An independent organisation Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air has released a list of largest importers of fossil fuels from Russia since it invaded Ukraine in February. Stating that Russia exported fossil fuels worth €63 billion, the study claims that Germany (€9.1 billion) was the biggest importer. It showed that US imported more fossil fuels than India.

381.title: Khadi becomes 1st Indian FMCG firm to clock over ₹1 lakh crore turnover
381.article_body: Khadi & Village Industries Commission (KVIC) has clocked a record annual turnover of ₹1.15 lakh crore in 2021-22. With this, it has become the first and only FMCG company in the country to have recorded a turnover of ₹1 lakh crore, the government said. KVIC's massive turnover comes despite partial lockdown due to second wave of COVID-19 pandemic, it added.

382.title: Big B sends handwritten letter to Ajay Devgn post 'Runway 34' release
382.article_body: Ajay Devgn on Saturday took to his social media handles to share a handwritten letter he received from his 'Runway 34' co-star Amitabh Bachchan. "An absolute honour to be a part of '34' and to be the recipient of a magnificent director's gift. Your work is superior," Big B wrote. Ajay also penned a note thanking Amitabh Bachchan.

383.title: No one from Bollywood called me on bypoll win, they're scared: Shatrughan
383.article_body: During an interview, actor and TMC leader Shatrughan Sinha said that no one from Bollywood called him after he won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls. He said, "I have not received a single congratulatory call from the film industry." "These people are so scared, they didn't even try to call...(they must've thought) What if the telephone is tapped," he added.

384.title: Pics show people across India as they battle heatwave
384.article_body: Parts of India are witnessing an intense heatwave, with temperatures in several cities crossing 40°C. Images show people battling heatwave, with one photo showing boys jumping in a water body and another showing a girl selling water using an umbrella to protect herself while waiting for customers. Delhi recorded its second hottest April in 72 years, IMD said on Friday.

385.title: 2 Pune hospitals shortlisted for final selection in govt's 'LaQshya' programme
385.article_body: Two Pune civic hospitals have been shortlisted for final selection in the Centre's Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative (LaQshya) programme, that aims to reduce maternal and newborn mortality. The hospitals shortlisted are Kamla Nehru Hospital and Chandumama Sonawane Maternity Home. The programme aims to improve the quality of care during delivery and post-partum period.

386.title: Coach booked for abetting 23-year-old Kerala basketball player's suicide
386.article_body: A case of abetment to suicide has been registered against an East Central Railway official, who is also a basketball coach, over the death of Lithara KC, a 23-year-old basketball player from Kerala. Lithara allegedly died by suicide at her flat in Bihar. Earlier, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, seeking a "comprehensive and fair investigation".

387.title: Imran Khan hints enemies paid his 2nd wife; she says 'how much did they pay for marriage'
387.article_body: Without naming his second wife Reham Khan, former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said, "This is the same [Sharif] mafia which paid a woman to write a book against me ahead of 2018 election." Taking to Twitter, Reham Khan replied, "Please ask him how much did they pay me to marry him? To put up with him for a year?"

388.title: Hyd Traffic Police conduct meeting to sensitise ambulance drivers
388.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police conducted a meeting with ambulance owners and drivers of Gandhi Hospital to sensitise them about traffic rules. "Sri K Rawe Shanker, [ACP traffic North Zone Secunderabad] conducted a meeting with ambulance owners and drivers of Gandhi Hospital, Secunderabad and sensitized them on traffic rules," police tweeted. Police told drivers not to demand excess money from patients.

389.title: Anushka Sharma cheers from stands as Kohli smashes fifty, video goes viral
389.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma cheered from the stands as Virat Kohli smashed his first fifty in IPL 2022. A video has gone viral, showing Anushka cheering loudly and giving Kohli a standing ovation. Kohli smashed a fifty in IPL after 14 matches. Kohi has now hit a total of 43 fifties in IPL.

390.title: Govt to sell 51% stake in Pawan Hans to Star9 Mobility for ₹211 cr
390.article_body: The government has approved the sale of its 51% shareholding in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility Private Ltd for ₹211.14 crore. Star9 is a consortium of Big Charter Private Limited, Maharaja Aviation Private Limited and Almas Global Opportunity Fund SPC. The helicopter and aero mobility company has been incurring losses over the last three years, the Finance Ministry said.

391.title: Ukraine national team to play friendly in May ahead of WC playoff
391.article_body: The Ukrainian national football team will play a friendly match on May 11 against German club Borussia Monchengladbach ahead of their World Cup playoff semi-final against Scotland on June 1. Ukraine last played in a 2-0 victory over Bosnia and Herzegovina in November. "All Ukrainian citizens will have free entry to the game," said Gladbach Chief Executive Stephan Schippers.

392.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹6.8 lakh on pretext of getting kidney transplant
392.article_body: A Gurugram-based 40-year-old man battling kidney failure was allegedly cheated of ₹6.8 lakh on the pretext of getting a transplant, police said. The victim, Raj Shourey, said, "[The suspect] got me in touch with...owner of a private hospital in Tamil Nadu, who assured me...they would...arrange kidneys for me." Shourey paid ₹6.8 lakh for the treatment, however, it didn't take place.

393.title: Congrats PM Modi for Varanasi's magical transformation: NBA's Howard on India visit
393.article_body: NBA legend Dwight Howard recently visited Varanasi and also shared pictures and videos from the visit on social media. "At peace with myself and the world...A spiritual journey that has rejuvenated the soul," said Howard. He added, "Congratulations (PM) Narendra Modi for the magical reformation of the holy city. Varanasi has inspired so many legends, I am humbled."

394.title: Teenage Maha boy gets shoved while dancing at wedding, stabs man to death
394.article_body: A teenage boy allegedly stabbed a 27-year-old man to death at a wedding in Maharashtra's Nagpur, police said. According to an officer, the incident took place when the two were dancing close to one another and the victim shoved the boy aside. The accused has been booked for murder and further investigation in the matter is underway.

395.title: Now, I'm feeling better: Shahdara rape victim after key accused held
395.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested Mukesh alias Mungeri, the last remaining and one of the prime accused in the Shahdara gang-rape case. After his arrest, the victim said, "Now, I'm feeling better," adding that it was Mukesh that she feared the most. Over 20 people were arrested after the 20-year-old victim was gang-raped and paraded with a blackened face in Shahdara.

396.title: It felt like Kuldeep was trying to buy wickets in IPL 2021: Vettori
396.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said it felt like DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "trying to buy wickets" while representing KKR in IPL 2021. "That may be [because]...Sunil Narine was a certainty and Varun Chakaravarthy was coming into the team," added Vettori. "Kuldeep thought 'If I don't do something I [will]...be out of the team straightaway'," stated Vettori.

397.title: Class 12 student dies by suicide after failing in MP board's English exam
397.article_body: A 17-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after failing the English paper in Class 12 board exams at Gudrughat village of Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat, police said. The deceased was reportedly feeling dejected after failing the exam. She was speaking to her cousin over the phone when she took the extreme step. The state's board exam results were declared on Friday.

398.title: Over 3,000 people lost at sea trying to cross to Europe in 2021: UN
398.article_body: A report by the UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) said 3,077 refugees, migrants and asylum seekers died or went missing at sea in 2021 trying to cross into Europe using Mediterranean and Atlantic sea routes. "We are seeing the increases soar," UNHCR's Shabia Mantoo said. "It's alarming," she added. The 2021 toll is nearly double the figure from 2020.

399.title: Not at all: Nawaz on if he was afraid to work with Kangana in 'Tiku...'
399.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, who'll star in Kangana Ranaut's first production venture 'Tiku Weds Sheru', spoke about working with Kangana and said, "I enjoyed it a lot." When asked about the perception that Kangana is difficult to work with, he said, "Producers...like her are...rare." Asked if he was afraid to work with Kangana because of this perception, he said, "Not at all."

400.title: 'Spider-Man' director Jon Watts exits Marvel's 'Fantastic Four' reboot
400.article_body: Filmmaker Jon Watts has stepped down from directing Marvel Studios' 'Fantastic Four' reboot. Watts, who is known for directing Spider-Man movies, including 'Homecoming', 'Far From Home' and 'No Way Home', said he exited the film amid his decision to take a break from large scale superhero movies. He was announced as the director for 'Fantastic Four' reboot in December 2020.
